Claim the Welsh Colony of Patagonia

Y Wladfa, or Y Wladychfa Gymreig, are a collection of Welsh settlements in the Chubut Province of Septentrional Patagonia. Welshmen began colonizing the land along the Chubut River since 1865 and have founded many towns ever since, seeking to get away from British rule. Since British rule in the native Wales is no longer an issue, we could certainly lend a hand to our Welsh brothers in the south, who are most likely experiencing many hardships in the ruthless Patagonia, by annexing their settlements.
Diplomatically annex the Welsh Colony of Patagonia

Y Wladfa, or Y Wladychfa Gymreig, are a collection of Welsh settlements in the Chubut Province of Septentrional Patagonia. Welshmen began colonizing the land along the Chubut River since 1865 and have founded many towns ever since, seeking to get away from British rule. Since British rule in the native Wales is no longer an issue, we could certainly lend a hand to our Welsh brothers in the south, who are most likely experiencing many hardships in the ruthless Patagonia, by uniting our nations.

In $YEAR$, Welsh professor, preacher and nationalist Michael D. Jones, after having spent some time in the United Stated, approached the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government in order to propose a new "Little Wales beyond Wales", a Welsh-Speaking colony far away from the influence of the English Language. The Patagonia was chosen for its isolation and the fact that our government had offered them a hundred square miles of land along the Chubut River in exchange for settling the still-unconquered land in the name of $COUNTRY$. Shall the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government grant the request to put Michael D. Jones and his Company in control of a large tract of land in the area known as Lower Chubut for the settling of Welsh Immigrants?
Turn those damned British spies away.

As the settelements of Y Wladfa grow and prosper, in $YEAR$several Welsh Entrepreneurs have approached the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government once more, this time proposing the colonization of the Andean Piedmont further inland to the west, in the area locally known as Esquel.

The mouth of the Chubut River is difficult one to navigate, being shallow and with shifting sandbanks, and it was decided that a railway was required to connect the settlements in the Lower Chubut valley to the Valdes Peninsula. Welsh Entrepreneur Lewis Jones is the driving force behind this project and has been seeking funds for this railway in $COUNTRY$ as well as England and Wales, while also planning to take more Welsh settlers to the Chubut.
A Main Culture for our Realm.
We must choose a culture representing our union!
A Main Religion for our Realm.
We must choose a religion representing our union!
A Form of Government for our Realm.
We must choose a form of government representing our union!
We must choose a culture representing our union!
We must choose a religion representing our union!
We must choose a form of government representing our union!

Following the dying down of Jacobitism as a political threat in Britain and Ireland, with the firm establishment of Hanoverian Britain under the liberal, rationalist philosophy of the Enlightenment, a backlash of Romanticism in the late 18th century occurred and ‘the Celt’ was rehabilitated in literature, in a movement which is sometimes known as ‘Celtomania.’ This movement opened for many future contacts between Celtic peoples, like Welsh and Bretons working together to translate the Bible into Breton, and even Celtic Studies being developed as an academic discipline in many universities across the continent. In the outset of $YEAR$, many $COUNTRY_ADJ$scholars have gathered to discuss a way to preserve our cultural identity from foreign encroachment employing what they deemed as ‘Pan-Celticist Ideals.’ Inspired by other nationalist movements across Europe, they advocate for solidarity and close cultural cooperation between the Celtic Nations whom we share cultural ties with in the form of higher regional autonomy, music, arts and literature festivals, while a more extreme faction advocates for the secession of Celtic Nations from their overlords and even the formation of a Pan-Celtic Federal State together. Whatever is the case, our peoples cannot be ignored, and by fomenting these ideals even further, we could inspire our Celtic Brethren to devise their own cultural awakenings. It is time for the Celts to return to the spotlight, our peoples simply cannot vanish from this world!

Backwards and almost devastated by hundreds of years of British mismanagement and oppression, a great deal of investment will be needed to be spent on Ireland if we wish to bring them up to par as an integral part of $COUNTRY$. To not only upgrade the decaying institutions which have been governing the island for centuries, but to also end the system of absentee landowners which so pervades the island's bureaucracy and which makes it a model of inefficiency. Only once that is done can Ireland be reborn as a modern nation.

An aborted attempt at an uprising recently took place in the village of Ballingarry, Ireland. A group of Irish nationalists, frustrated by what they call the inept handling of the recent famine by the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government, engaged in a long gunfight with a unit of constabulary until reinforcements arrived and drove the men off. Many of these nationalists have since been captured and tried, but the event has sparked an increase in nationalism across the island.
The treacherous Transcaucasians have engineered a coup, efficiently breaking the union and setting free all the countries which comprised the oblast!

As nationalistic sentiment grows within the many peoples of Transcaucasia, a valiant group of politicians have engineered a coup to set the Southern Caucasus free from Russian suzerainty, the Transcaucasian Oblast shall be abolished in its entirety making headway for the old, pre-Russian territorial divisions.\nFour factions have asked our diplomats for help, it is now time to pick a side…

After a successful coup lead by Transcaucasia's top nobles and politicians, the union crumbles into several smaller countries… \nIn these uncertain times, one can only wonder what does the future hold for the people of the Caucasus…

Among our Georgian subjects there are many nobles claiming Bagratid descent, several of which have approached our top advisors with a bold proposition: The unification of Georgia and Armenia. By doing so, we could easily obtain claims on Georgian territories, allowing us to expand way beyond our borders.

Among our Armenian subjects there are many nobles claiming Bagratid descent, several of which have approached our top advisors with a bold proposition: The unification of Armenia and Georgia. By doing so, we could easily obtain claims on Armenian territories, allowing us to expand way beyond our borders.

An important waterway and a natural border between Argentinian and Brazillian provinces, no longer shall we be the the Banda oriental of the Uruguay as the whole river will flow through the very heart of our nation. It is our claim.

After our people embraced the ideals of Christendom, there has been a constant influx of missionaries on our country. By establishing more Missionary schools throughout the territory, we could form more missionaries to spread the christian faith and educate the populace.
Christian missionaries are spreading the word of Jesus and the ideals of the civilized world.

The 1839 Hawaiian Bill of Rights, also known as the 1839 Constitution of Hawaii, was an attempt by Kamehameha III and his chiefs to guarantee that the Hawaiian people would not lose their tenured land, and provided the groundwork for a free enterprise system. The document, which had an attached code of laws, was drafted by Lahainaluna missionary school alumnus Boaz Mahune, revised by the Council of Chiefs and by Kamehameha III in June 1839.

On July 10, 1850 the Hawaiian legislature passed the Alien Land Ownership Act. It allowed foreigners to hold title to land. The Act was written by Chief Justice William Little Lee. The justification was the promise of prosperity resulting from an influx of much-needed capital and labor.
Foreigners may own land in our territories.
Lift the ban on cattle killing

Captain George Vancouver brought cattle and sheep in 1793 as a gift to Kamehameha I, monarch of the Hawaiian Kingdom. For 10 years, Kamehameha forbade killing of cattle, and imposed the death penalty on anyone who violated his edict. As a result, numbers multiplied astonishingly, and were wreaking havoc throughout the countryside. By the reign of Kamehameha III the number of wild cattle were becoming a problem, so in 1832 he sent an emissary to California, then still a part of Mexico. He was impressed with the skill of the vaqueros, and invited three to Hawaii to teach the Hawaiian people how to work cattle. By 1837 John Parker, a sailor from New England who settled in the islands, received permission from Kamehameha III to lease royal land near Mauna Kea, where he built a ranch.
Paniolos are Hawaiian cowboys who learned the cattle-wrangling ways from Mexican Vaqueros.
All Pioneers must unite under a single flag and together achieve our destiny to live in complete freedom!
While originally part of Russia, Alaska's climate and topographic features are much alike to those in our homeland, by laying claims over the region, our people would have even more land to settle!

Freedom and homesteading, the two principal values of our nation, have attracted a great quantity of migrants from all across the globe looking for opportunity, and indeed, $COUNTRY$ has given them what these people so desperately sought after… Our people are so grateful that they have begun referring to themselves as 'Naturalized Cascadians' instead of using the name of their nation of origin. This gratefulness has made our top statesmen, as well as intellectuals, to wonder: What does it truly mean to be Cascadian? $COUNTRY$ is still young, and we are in dire need to define our culture and customs lest we become a melting pot with no real identity of our own… The Settler, the Lumberjack, the Miner, the Farmer, the Furrier and the Fisherman, all belong to $COUNTRY$, their freedom will be the lifeblood of our nation and the bond keeping us together. From this day, the Cascadian people shall be born.
We must choose a proper capital for our nation!
After consolidating our independence, it is high time to lay claims on our rightful territories: The basin of the Aquiri!

The Provisional Government of Oregon was a popularly elected settler government created in the Oregon Country, in the Pacific Northwest region of North America. Its formation had been advanced at the Champoeg Meetings since February 17, 1841 and it existed from May 2, 1843 until March 3, 1849, and provided a legal system and a common defense amongst the mostly American pioneers settling an area then inhabited only by the many Indigenous Nations.

The Provisional Government of Oregon was a popularly elected settler government created in the Oregon Country, in the Pacific Northwest region of North America. Its formation had been advanced at the Champoeg Meetings since February 17, 1841 and it existed from May 2, 1843 until March 3, 1849, and provided a legal system and a common defense amongst the mostly American pioneers settling an area then inhabited only by the many Indigenous Nations.

The Provisional Government of Oregon was a popularly elected settler government created in the Oregon Country, in the Pacific Northwest region of North America. Its formation had been advanced at the Champoeg Meetings since February 17, 1841 and it existed from May 2, 1843 until March 3, 1849, and provided a legal system and a common defense amongst the mostly American pioneers settling an area then inhabited only by the many Indigenous Nations.
We will support them! (Play as the Oregon Country)

Until such time as the United States of America extend their jurisdiction over us. is a quote from the Organic laws of Oregon, adopted by the settlers of these territories back in 1843. Several years have passed since then and the government of the United States of America has finally decided to extend their jurisdiction over us. A sizable part of the settlers wish to remain independent, while the others wish to be part of the Union… What shall our decision be?
Gold coins minted in Oregon, they contain 8% more gold than contemporary coins from the United States of America.

Beaver Coins were gold coins minted in Oregon in 1849. Their name comes from the prominent beaver depicted on the obverse of the coins. The currency contained 8% more gold than contemporary coins from the United States of America. The primarily American settler population of the Oregon Country, based in the Willamette Valley since the late 1830s, lacked a stable currency. A variety of items were held valid by the Provisional Government of Oregon, including specie from Mexico and Peru, beaver skins and wheat. After the beginning of the California Gold Rush an estimated 2,000,000 dollars worth of gold entered the Oregon settlements within two years. Disputes often arose during transactions over the value of the gold dust, generally rife with impurities.

A Frenchman, who goes by the name of Orélie-Antoine de Tounens, has been visiting many of the local Lonkos in Araucania. This man, clearly of noble descent, seeks to unite the Lonkos in what he proposes to be the Kingdom of Araucania and Patagonia, an extensive country stretching way across the Andes to the Atlantic ocean… His ambition is admirable and his cause noble, we could gain a diplomatic advantage by having a French nobleman on our side, perhaps that way the Chileans could finally leave our people alone.
Rob him blind, he's just another foreigner who wants to steal our lands…
We're currently rebuilding the ancient city of Ani
Rebuild the ancient city of Ani
Now that the province of Kars is under our control, we can rebuild the ancient Armenian city of Ani and turn it into a modern highland metropolis! There won't be any room for invaders, however.
Solve the territorial claims over the Kars region.

The Russians have been our allies for the past centuries, yet these disputes over the territories of Kars are getting out of hand. By solving these territorial claims with Russia, both of our empires can resume their friendly relations, hopefully for the ages to come!
The time has come to expel the Turks from our lands once and for all.
The time has come to expel the Turks from our lands once and for all.
The time has come to expel the Turks from our lands once and for all.
The time has come to expel the Turks from our lands once and for all.
The time has come to expel the Azeri Turks from our lands once and for all.
The time has come to expel the Azeri Turks from our lands once and for all.
The time has come to expel the Azeri Turks from our lands once and for all.
The Naval doctrines of Minister Manuel Ezequiel Bruzual

Manuel Ezequiel Bruzual, Minister of the Navy, has proposed the adoption of several changes to our naval doctrines, mainly the transition from old wind-propelled vessels to the way of the future: Steamer ships. With the help of the Naval Great Powers, Minister Manuel Ezequiel Bruzual has acquired several steamer boats for our navy, along with the logistics and the know-how for these brand new contraptions.

In $YEAR$, slavery was abolished in $COUNTRY$. It was a long and gradual process which took almost decades to reach completion… Thus as decreed by the $MONARCHTITLE$, slavery shall be outlawed in Venezuela. All former masters shall be paid a small monetary remuneration for each freed slave.
The Dominican Republic asks Spain for Suzerainty

In 1861 general Pedro Santana asked queen Isabella II of Spain to retake control of the Dominican Republic, after a period of only 17 years of independence. Spain, which had not come to terms with the loss of its Continental American colonies 40 years earlier or so, accepted his proposal and made the country a colony again. A Dominican Insurgency erupted oppose to Spanish rule.
The Dominican Republic asks Spain for Suzerainty

After more than a decade of mismanagement, several conservative politicians in $COUNTRY$ have argued that our nation would be better off under Spanish rule once again. Of course such allegations angered the liberal factions, but in truth, our country could use a helping hand in these trying times…
We must secure a future for Hispaniola!
Outrageous proposal! We will never be a colony again!
The Dominican Republic asks Spain for Suzerainty

In $YEAR$ Dominican general Pedro Santana approached the $MONARCHTITLE$ of $COUNTRY$ with a proposition to retake control of the Dominican Republic, after a period of only 17 years of independence, much corruption and mismanagement and the ever-looming threat of another Haitian invasion.\nThough this might be beneficial in the long run, the United States of America is always watchful for any European powers that might try to threaten the region's integrity… They might declare war on us if we intervene in the Dominican Republic.
Indeed, this would greatly benefit us all.
We cannot, it is too risky.
Spain takes over the Dominican Republic

Spain has taken over the Dominican republic, although peacefully, this signifies a transgression to our Monroe Doctrine, which we could enact freely as they are a European power mingling with the politics of these newly-formed South American nations.
Spain agrees to be our Suzerain.
News have arrived from Spain, it appears they wish to be our suzerains once more!
Spain refuses to be our Suzerain.
News have arrived from Spain, it appears they wish to have nothing to do with us!
After dealing with the regional unrest that had struck Santo Domingo, we are now in a position to formally annex their territories whilst also laying claims all over the island of Hispaniola.

Officially entitled 'Tratado de Paz, Amistad, Navegación y Comercio', was a treaty meant to represent an agreement of mutual cooperation between the United States of America and the Nueva Granada Republic.  It granted the U.S. significant transit rights over the Panamanian isthmus, as well as military powers to suppress social conflicts and independence struggles targeted against Colombia.
Persian Azerbaijan has long been a cultural center for the Azeri people and as a part of the Transcaucasian Union, they should be rightfully under our suzerainty.
Mets' Hayk, or Greater Armenia, was the ancient kingdom of the Armenians of antiquity. As the Transcaucasian Union, we hold rightful claims over these territories and the Armenians inhabiting them.
Jiqet'i, present day Sochi, used to be part of the Georgian Empire almost 600 years ago. It is time us, as the Transcaucasian Union, reclaim these old territories.

Nobody knows how it started for certain and the details are fragmentary, however, the episode involved a fight that broke out between two Spaniard residents and 40 local citizens. As a result, one Spaniard died and four others were injured. When news of the incident reached Spanish Admiral Luis Hernández Pinzón, who was on his way to California on a scientific expedition, he returned with his fleet to Peru on and demanded that the government issue an apology and reparations be made to the affected Spanish nationals. \nHe seemed very angry about this whole situation, there has been talks with a war with Spain if proper reparations are not paid.
Issue an apology and pay reparations, we cannot risk war

Nobody knows how it started for certain and the details are fragmentary, however, the episode involved a fight that broke out between two Spaniard residents and 40 local citizens. As a result, one Spaniard died and four others were injured. When news of the incident reached Spanish Admiral Luis Hernández Pinzón, who was on his way to California on a scientific expedition, he returned with his fleet to Peru on and demanded that the government issue an apology and reparations be made to the affected Spanish nationals. \nIt appears Peru has decided to play it safe and pay proper respects and reparations
Good. Let them know their place.

Nobody knows how it started for certain and the details are fragmentary, however, the episode involved a fight that broke out between two Spaniard residents and 40 local citizens. As a result, one Spaniard died and four others were injured. When news of the incident reached Spanish Admiral Luis Hernández Pinzón, who was on his way to California on a scientific expedition, he returned with his fleet to Peru on and demanded that the government issue an apology and reparations be made to the affected Spanish nationals. \nIt appears Peru has decided not to pay proper respects and reparations
We cannot wage a war so far away
Angered by our response, $FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided to declare war. They've occupied the Chincha Islandd off the coast of Ica.
This is a declaration of war!
Angered by our response, $FROMCOUNTRY$ only sent us a diplomatic insult. They have seemed to have backed down on their threats however…
They better fear our military might!

The Armenian Fedayi, derived from Arabic fedayeen literally meaning "those who sacrifice", were Armenian civilians who voluntarily left their families to form self-defense units and irregular armed bands in reaction to the mass murder of Armenians and the pillage of Armenian villages by Ottoman criminals and tribal Kurdish forces. Their ultimate goal was always to gain Armenian autonomy or independence depending on their ideology and the degree of oppression visited on Armenians. By funding these nationalistic guerrillas we could strive to obtain control of Ottoman-controlled territories where our people are majority.
While we had hoped to have no quarrels with France, with their claims on Piemonte it is now impossible. We must lay claim to Provence, and liberate the Italians therein through force of arms.
Now that the French have been defeated, their claims on Piemonte have been nullified.
Provence is rightfully $COUNTRY_ADJ$, and should use Italian names.
Provence is rightfully $COUNTRY_ADJ$, and should use French names.
The Turks’ Status: The Suppression Act

This unfortunate race, whom have had so much disdain for our people and have caused us do much pain in the past centuries, have by their unexpected desertion and ferocious barbarities justified extermination and now await our decision on their fate.\nThe $COUNTRY_ADJ$spokesperson addressed a cabinet of ministers and advisors of the $MONARCHTITLE$ in regards to the new government policy. The decision has been made, and the new government stance will be one of persecution and marginalization of the turkishs until they are completely driven off $COUNTRY$.
The End of the Integration Act
After twenty years, the government's integration policy towards the Turks is coming under revision. By enacting this decision we can renew it or select a new policy.
The Turks’ Status: The Integration Act

A Turk is but a Muslim $COUNTRY_ADJ$! Hundreds of years of rape and assimilation have turned these poor creatures into savages with no real heritage. Indeed the shape of their skulls might be slightly different, mongoloid even, but their skin and hair pigmentation are $COUNTRY_ADJ$ to be sure! We shall strive to make the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ language mandatory in their schools and force them to take $COUNTRY_ADJ$ names, just as they did with us in the past. An eye for an eye, they say. It is the one and only solution! \n\nOne of $COUNTRY$’s top anthropologists addressed a crowd in $CAPITAL$, delineating the government's policy of integrating the Turks in $COUNTRY_ADJ$society. It will be hard to move them from their traditional villages and it might take a while, but the government is determined that the Turks of $COUNTRY$ will become $COUNTRY_ADJ$ in every aspect.
The Turks’ Status: The Protection Act

Every Turk of $COUNTRY$ and every Turk halfcaste or child of a half-caste, such half-caste or child habitually associating and living with Turks, shall be deemed to be an Turk within the meaning of this Act, and at the hearing of any case the justice adjudicating may, in the absence of other sufficient evidence, decide on his own view and judgment whether any person with reference to whom any proceedings shall have been taken under this Act is or is not a Turk. If any person shall violate the provisions of any regulation made under or in pursuance of this Act, or shall obstruct the Board or local committee or any local guardian of Turks or other officer in the execution of his duty under this Act or the said regulations, every such person shall on conviction forfeit and pay a fine. Be it enacted by his excellency the $MONARCHTITLE$ and with the advice and consent of the Legislative Council and Legislative Assembly of $COUNTRY$ in this present Parliament assembled and by the authority of the same that all Turk of $COUNTRY$ will be under protection of the state and will be regarded as $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens.

Ever since the reclamation of $COUNTRY$, the Turks have been relegated to a marginal role in $COUNTRY_ADJ$society. Marginalized or simply ignored, the Turks are growing increasingly militant about their status while other countries turn their gaze on our treatment of the first peoples of $COUNTRY$. There are talks in $CAPITAL$ about an official policy on regards to our treatment of the Turks: should we keep the status quo? Give them full rights? Try to assimilate them in $COUNTRY_ADJ$ culture? Should we try to drive them to the edge of extinction?
We haven't reached a consensus on how to proceed with the Turkish question.
The government is working towards the assimilation of the Turkish population.
Discriminatory policies aim to eliminate and push out the Turkish population.

Despite the growing popularity of tea in $COUNTRY$, there are no tea producing provinces in our homeland. Now the microclimate region along the eastern coast of the Black Sea was identified by specialists as an ideal spot to start tea production, which will contribute to the task of fulfilling the growing demand for tea by the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens. However, this knowledge is kept largely a secret by the British and they are bound to be dissatisfied if we start our own tea production.
We have inherited the Island Country of Chios & Samos!
Several territories in the eastern part of Europe were once Polish, and should be Polish once again.
Several territories in the southern Baltic Coast were once Polish, and should be Polish once again.
Ostpreußen is rightfully $COUNTRY_ADJ$, and should use $COUNTRY_ADJ$ names.
Prusy Wschodnie is rightfully $COUNTRY_ADJ$, and should use $COUNTRY_ADJ$ names.
Rytu Prusija is rightfully $COUNTRY_ADJ$, and should use $COUNTRY_ADJ$ names.
Königsberg is rightfully $COUNTRY_ADJ$, and should use $COUNTRY_ADJ$ names.
East Prussia is rightfully $COUNTRY_ADJ$, and should use $COUNTRY_ADJ$ names.
We own the Bosporus, linking the Sea of Marmara and the Black Sea, and we receive the dividends of its toll and glory for its possession.
We own the Dardanelles, linking the Aegean Sea and the Sea of Marmara, and we receive the dividends of its toll and glory for its possession.
The time has come for Georgia to be unified once again. Long live Sakartvelo!
We will reform Georgia, a strong and united ally under our control.
The time has come for Azerbaijan to be unified. Long live Azerbaijan!
We will reform Azerbaijan, a strong and united ally under our control.
The Kars Oblast should be under the administration of our vassal, the Transcaucasian Union.

As the centuries passed, several of the Georgian principalities broke off from our Kingdom. But no longer, for it is our time to claim those territories that which is rightfully ours, for the unification of Georgia is coming, and nothing will stand in our way!
Whether by the sword or by the pen, it is not consequential how Georgia is unified, but that it must be. The first step begins with the merging of the Kartli and Kakheti kingdoms.
An end to the Turkish Question
After having conquered most of our ancient borders, a question still lingers in the minds of our top statesmen: What shall be done about the Turks still living in Anatolia?
An end to the Turkish Question

After the expulsion of the Ottoman Empire from Anatolia, the Turks living in our country have grown increasingly restless about their social status. Most of our upper upper house wishes to end the Turkish Question through the complete reduction of the Turkish populations within our lands. There are three proposals in the $COUNTRY$ to achieve this goal. The first, and most popular among less hardline groups, is to displace them all into the former Ankara, and appoint civil administrators to watch over them. The more extreme proposal introduced by the current government is for outright killing, with 'Eidikés Omádes Drásis' being deployed to raid and destroy Turkish villages. Both are sure to be time-consuming and expensive, as well as damaging to our internation reputation. But, it must be done.
Implement the harliners' plan, these 'people' have always been our enemies.
Displacement seems most practical. Contain them within Ankyra.
We cannot allow this to happen. Veto the bill entirely and issue a gag order on the matter.
Our plan to remove the Turks continues as planned. Another state has been cleared.
Our plan to remove the Turks continues as planned. Another state has been cleared.
Government initiatives have been put forward to integrate Turks into society through various programs.
The Dutch colonies of Aruba, Bonaire and Curaçao are a collection of small islands of the coast of Venezuela and should rightully belong to us.

Originally a colony belonging to the Spaniards, Dutch, French and then the Spaniards again until 1797, the islands of Trinidad and Tobago are located off the coast of Venezuela and should rightly belong to us.
Negate the Territorial Partition of Poland
Three times was our great nation torn apart by foreign invaders, but no more we say, for this new sovereign Poland shall never die!

Our Orthodox brothers in faith have come under our rule, and while they might be reluctant to be ruled by us, we could negotiate a compromise by accepting their culture and language throughout our realm.

Our Orthodox brothers in faith have come under our rule, and while they might be reluctant to be ruled by us, we could negotiate a compromise by accepting their culture and language throughout our realm.

Our Orthodox brothers in faith have come under our rule, and while they might be reluctant to be ruled by us, we could negotiate a compromise by accepting their culture and language throughout our realm.
After centuries under Muslim yoke, the Armenian people are under the rule of their brothers in faith once again. Rest easy, for your culture and language shall be protected for the ages to come.
After centuries under Muslim yoke, the Assyrian people are under the rule of their brothers in faith once again. Rest easy, for your culture and language shall be protected for the ages to come.
After centuries under Muslim yoke, the Coptic people are under the rule of their brothers in faith once again. Rest easy, for your culture and language shall be protected for the ages to come.
King of Kings, Ruler of Rulers
column4: König der Könige, Herrscher der Herrscher
column6: Rey de reyes, gobernante de gobernantes

column2: With the collapse of the Ottoman Empire, the Ottoman claims to Imperial Roman titles, so viciously and deceitfully wrought from Greek hands in the dark year of 1453, are all fast becoming fading memories. Constantinople, the City of Man's Desire, is again, after centuries of Turkish occupation, in Greek hands. As years and time passed again, again ours they were. Basileos, proclaim our Empire restored!
column3: Avec la chute de l’Empire ottoman, les prétentions ottomanes sur les titres de la Rome impériale, arrachés des mains grecques par traitrise et fourberie en cette sombre année 1453, ne sont plus que des souvenirs oubliés. Constantinople, la ville des désirs d’un homme, est de nouveau grecque après des siècles d’occupation turque. Tandis que les années passaient, notre heure est revenue. Basileos, proclame notre empire restauré !
column4: Durch den Zusammenbruch des osmanischen Reiches wird von den osmanischen Ansprüchen an kaiserlich-römische Titel, die man den Griechen im schwarzen Jahr 1453 so brutal und hinterlistig entrissen hatte, bald nicht mehr als schnell verblassende Erinnerungen übrig sein. Konstantinopel, die Stadt der sieben Hügel, ist nach Jahrhunderten türkischer Besetzung nun wieder in griechischen Händen. Basileos, proklamiere unser Reich als wiederhergestellt!
column6: Con el colapso del Imperio Otomano, las pretensiones de los turcos con respecto a los títulos imperiales romanos, tan cruel y maliciosamente arrebatadas de manos de los griegos en el sombrío año de 1453, están quedando relegadas a la condición de mero recuerdo. Constantinopla, la 'Ciudad del Deseo del Hombre', vuelve a estar, tras siglos de ocupación turca, en manos de los griegos. Han pasado muchos años, pero todo vuelve a su lugar. ¡Basileos, proclamad la restauración de nuestro imperio!

column2: Our proper place lies with Greece. Long live the Hellenic destiny!

A long and heated debate is currently ensuing in our parliament, the subject is whether or not should Greece enact an expansionist policy to possibly lay claims on all Greek-inhabited areas of the Balkans and Anatolia or to keep our current borders. As we very well know, our independence came at the cost of many lives of both civilians and military personnel and several of our statesmen are against expanding any further from the lands we have already got claims on. Even still, the idea of bringing freedom to our brothers under Ottoman yoke fills us with new hope and we cannot ignore the fact that their future might be uncertain at the hands of those barbarians. Ultimately, it is up to a small fraction of our parliament to decide whether or not said policies should be enacted…

A long and heated debate is currently ensuing in our parliament, the subject is whether or not should Greece enact an expansionist policy to possibly lay claims on all Greek-inhabited areas of the Balkans and Anatolia or to keep our current borders. As we very well know, our independence came at the cost of many lives of both civilians and military personnel and several of our statesmen are against expanding any further from the lands we have already got claims on. Even still, the idea of bringing freedom to our brothers under Ottoman yoke fills us with new hope and we cannot ignore the fact that their future might be uncertain at the hands of those barbarians. Ultimately, it is up to a small fraction of our parliament to decide whether or not said policies should be enacted…
Irredentism is the way of our people!
I believe we have expanded enough already!

As our Empire grows in both wealth and territory, our people have begun to wonder: What does it really mean to be Hellenic? It is no secret our independence movement based itself on a common cultural and religious heritage, ignoring those who did not profess the Christian faith, we opted to call ourselves Hellenes rather than Rhomanoi as to differentiate ourselves from those still under Ottoman yoke who did not wish, or could not, become part of our great nation due to geographical or even religious reasons. Still, the legacy of the original Rhomanoi lives inside all of us, not in the Ottoman Rum Millet, but inside every Orthodox Greek, every Hellene. This way of thinking has brought us new possibilities for expansion, to encompass those who still are under foreign suzerainty and even those who used to be our former subjects… after all, we all share some degree of cultural heritage which should never be ignored, bringing these people together under one state shall be our utmost priority.

Serbia, our longstanding brother in faith, has come under the influence of our Empire. This small nation of proud and hardy people, having endured hundreds of years of Ottoman aggression, has finally been liberated from their former overlords. It has come to our attention that several international powers might wish to sway them to their side, as it is usual in these turbulent times we live in, and we are here to stand in their path. It is time for our Serbian brethren to come under the protection of our Empire and to secure the existence of their culture and heritage for the ages to come.

Montenegro, our longstanding brother in faith, has come under the influence of our Empire. This small nation of proud and hardy people, having endured hundreds of years of Ottoman aggression, has finally been liberated from their former overlords. It has come to our attention that several international powers might wish to sway them to their side, as it is usual in these turbulent times we live in, and we are here to stand in their path. It is time for our Montenegrin brethren to come under the protection of our Empire and to secure the existence of their culture and heritage for the ages to come.

The top statesmen of The $COUNTRY$, emboldened by our status among the international community, have suggested we annex our Serbian subjects on the pretext of a common Orthodox and Byzantine heritage. A strong propaganda machine is required, and even still not all inhabitants of Serbia will be pleased by our decision. Nevertheless our Empire shall grow ever stronger from this bold diplomatic move.

The top statesmen of The $COUNTRY$, emboldened by our status among the international community, have suggested we annex our Montenegrin subjects on the pretext of a common Orthodox and Byzantine heritage. A strong propaganda machine is required, and even still not all inhabitants of Montenegro will be pleased by our decision. Nevertheless our Empire shall grow ever stronger from this bold diplomatic move.
The Great Game Comes to Kharan
We must press our domination of Central Asia. This means that Kharan must be subjugated as a British colony, or we risk losing it to Russian aggression in the region.
The Great Game Comes to Lasbela
We must press our domination of Central Asia. This means that Lasbela must be subjugated as a British colony, or we risk losing it to Russian aggression in the region.

Our recent gains against the muslim oppressors has caused much fervour amongst our population, and as their crumbling Empire is pushed back to the far reaches of Asia Minor, we are on the perfect position to declare their claims on European and Anatolian soil as null. Turks don't belong here and we ought to let them know that.
Tensions arise in Bandar Abbas and the Persian Coastline.

The Governors of Fars and Kerman are threatening to besiege the province of Bandar Abbas, previously leased to the Sultanate of Muscat-Oman under rightful terms, seeking to exort tribute from us. As a result, some of our Admirals are threatening to blockade their ports and the British Resident at Bushire is doing his best to convince the Persians, as well as our top statesmen, to back down lest this situation escalates in war.
Tensions arise in Bandar Abbas and the Persian Coastline.

The Governors of Fars and Kerman are threatening to besiege the province of Bandar Abbas, previously leased to the Sultanate of Muscat-Oman, seeking to exort tribute from them. As a result, the Omanis are threatening to blockade our ports and the British Resident at Bushire is doing his best to convince the Omanis, as well as our top statesmen, to back down lest this situation escalates in war.
An Opportunity to seize Bandar Abbas and the Persian Coastline arises!

While the Sultan of Muscat-Oman rules far away from the island of Zanzibar located in Africa, his rule over the furthest reaches of the Sultanate has exponentially weakened. Bandar Abbas is no exception and an opportunity has arisen to peacefully take back our rightful territories.
Do not! This could anger their overlords!
The lease period of our territories in Bandar Abbas has come to an end, shall we renew the lease?
British pressure to renew the lease on Bandar Abbas and the Persian Coast.

Following our defeat on the Anglo-Persian war, under British pressure, we are being told to renew Muscat-Oman's lease on Bandar Abbas under favourable terms. This time however, it is clarified that the territory is part of Persia's sovereignty and that our flag shall fly over Bandar Abbas all year-round.
Accept, we are in no position to object.
No, we have been humiliated far enough.
British pressure to renew the lease on Bandar Abbas and the Persian Coast.

Following the Persian defeat on the Anglo-Persian war, under british pressure, we are being suggested to renew our lease on Bandar Abbas, demanding more favourable terms for Persia. This time however, it is clarified that the territory is part of Persia's sovereignty and that their flag shall fly over Bandar Abbas all year-round.
The lease period of Bandar Abbas is about to end and once again the British are breathing down our necks… shall we:
Don't let the Omanis renew it.
The lease period of Bandar Abbas is about to end… we shall:
Trouble brews in the Sultanate of Muscat-Oman!

The Sultan of Muscat-Oman, Salim bin Thuwayni Al-Busaid, has been deposed by the recently-elected Imam Azzan bin Qais Al-Busaid of the Imamate of Oman Proper. As per our agreement, we shall cite a clause in which it is stated that if the Omani Sultan is ever overthrown, we are in position to legally cancel the lease without any repercussions.
Then the lease shall be terminated.
Do not, this could anger their overlords.
Trouble brews in the Sultanate of Muscat-Oman!

After the deposition of our former sultan, Salim bin Thuwayni Al-Busaid, by the recently-elected Imam Azzan bin Qais Al-Busaid of the Imamate of Oman Proper. Persia is citing a clause on our lease in which it is stated that if the Omani Sultan is ever overthrown, they are in position to legally cancel the lease without any repercussions.
Refuse to give back our rightful territories!

In $YEAR$, Azzan bin Qais Al-Busaid, a distant relative of our current rulers, was elected Imam by disgrunted tribesmen seeking to lead the country back to the principles of classical Ibadi state and to overthrow our current Sultan Salim bin Thuwayni Al-Busaid. While he is stirring trouble in the province of Nizwa, soon enough their unrest could spread across our whole country.
It's time to put an end to this, execute him!

In $YEAR$, upon subduing what was left of Circassia, the Russian Empire launched a major campaign to rid the Northeastern Caucaus from their native peoples. Circassians, most of whom were the majority in this area, were forced to migrate and those who opposed were systematically killed by the Authorities of the Russian Empire. Our country has seen a recent influx of North Caucasian Immigrants, and their numbers are predicted to increase in the months to come.
By all means, take them in!
Turn them away, a sudden influx of migrants could destabilize our realm!

Due to the recent influx of Çerkes immigrants who were resettled mostly in parts of our empire in which Christianity was the majority as a loyal counterweight population to the rebellious natives, coupled with our inability to properly build new housing facilities and grant aid to the recently-displaced Çerkes, the newly-established Circassian population has resorted to banditry to fulfil their daily needs. This, coupled with the precarious conditions of the camps in which the Çerkes have been settled, has caused huge unrest among the native population as well as with the Çerkes immigrants. These people are destitute and there is nothing we can do but to wait until the situation cools down.
At least try to improve their situation!

Upon receiving a huge influx of Circassian immigrants, fear of them due to the diseases they spread and the stereotype of them as either beggars or bandits, became so great that Christian and Muslim communities alike would protest upon hearing that Circassians were to be settled near them.

We have been declared a threat to international balance of power. Sanctions have been applied to our country and citizens and we have been warned that the great powers will worsen these sanctions in case we continue our lack of cooperation.
We own the Bab-el-Mandeb, linking the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden, and we receive the dividends of its toll and glory for its possession.
We own the Strait of Hormuz, linking the Persian Gulf and the Gulf of Oman, and we receive the dividends of its toll and glory for its possession.

After receiving a massive influx of Circassian immigrants originating from Northwest Caucasia, most of which practice the Islamic faith, the Ottoman Empire settled great part of these immigrants in the Balkans as a loyal counterweight population to the rebellious Christian natives. This dastardly move caused the forced eviction of natives from their homes, making way for Circassians who were supposed to act as a suppressive element on the local Christians… as one would expect, unrest soon ensued as Christian communities were separated and resettled far away from one another. One of such places is Bulgaria, a region that is now under our control. By expelling these Circassians immigrants to Anatolia, we can allow the locals to consolidate power on their native land once more.

One of our provinces has come under enemy occupation and due to our inability to recover it, the Çerkes we settled there have been expelled with aid from the locals. We have been informed that the expelled immigrants shall shortly arrive in Anatolia, as the natives do not wish to take them in.

Located in the Arabian Sea off the coast of Oman, the Khuriya Muriya Archipelago forms a group of five sparsely inhabited islands. The islands would be an ideal place for a coaling station for our ships coming and going from India, Persia and Eastern Africa.

Located off the coast of Tunisia in the Gulf of Gabes, the island of Djerba is the largest island of North Africa and a likely candidate for a coaling station as well as a strategic protectorate for any future incursions into the continent.

The Khuria Muriya Archipelago are a small cluster of sparsely inhabited islands off our coast, and while they pose no particular economic importance, it could be of great use for the Great Power currently protecting us. While several statesmen doubt our claims over the Archipelago, granting our friendly Great Power sovereignty over these islands could give us many benefits in the future…

The Sultan of Muscat-Oman has decided to present the islands of Khuriya Muriya as a gift to our $MONARCHTITLE$. This small Archipelago forms a group of five sparsely inhabited islands located in the Arabian Sea off the coast of Oman. While the islands themselves pose no notable resources to exploit besides guano and are also severely underdeveloped and underpopulated, their strategic position on the Arabian Sea could serve us greatly in the near future. Though the Sultan seems eager to grant us this gift, several Ambassadors and natives from Oman doubt the Sultan's claim over the islands, stating that he holds no rights over the Archipelago… should we accept this gift despite its dubious legality?
Absolutely, accept it despite any objections from the natives.
Turn it away, the deed might be null after all.
Our friendly Great Power accepts the gift!
Our friendly Great Power has turned away the gift!

Pressure has been building up in the colonies which had a slave-majority workforce following the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ abolishment of slavery in 1833. With widespread strikes from former slaves plotting against their former masters, the arduous working conditions have caused the labourers to refuse doing their work and even become hostile in general… we are in dire need of a massive, docile workforce we could easily employ to do the jobs these former slaves refuse to perform. Luckily, the answer lies in India, a territory which possesses a massive population that is much willing to work overseas. Should we establish an Indian Indenture System, our neglected colonies shall be profitable once again.
Foreign indentured workers have been brought to this province.
Indian Indenture System in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Colonies

Indian Workers have had a minor presence in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colonies for a while now, but following the success that was the legalization of Indian Indenture by the British Empire, our colonies could benefit from this system as well in order to boost their production by employing even more Indians.

We could establish an indenture system for Javan workers willing to work on our colonies just like we did with Indians, and since Paramaribo has had a Javan presence for several years now, we could further bring even more of them to our colony.
Indian Indenture System in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Colonies

Indian Workers have had a minor presence in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colonies for a while now, but following the success that was the legalization of Indian Indenture by the British Empire, our colonies could benefit from this system as well in order to boost their production by employing even more Indians.
Indian Indenture System in South Africa

Indian and Malay Workers have had a minor presence in South Africa for a while now, and given the success of the Indian Indenture System in colonies all over the world, it is only logical we implement this in South Africa as well.
Given the success of the Indian Indenture System in colonies all over the world, it is only logical we implement this in Fiji as well.

Diamonds have been discovered in this province, drawing prospectors and miners from near and far.
Prospectors have discovered many diamond fields in $PROVINCENAME$!
$PROVINCENAME$'s diamond fields were thought to have been exhausted earlier this century, but several prospectors have discovered many new diamond fields there!

$PROVINCENAME$'s diamond fields have been extensively exploited since the early colonial times, but up until recently, our prospectors have been unable to find any new sources of diamonds. With the depletion of most diamond fields, we must now turn to our secondary exports: Gold.

$PROVINCENAME$'s gold has been extensively exploited since the early colonial times, but up until recently, our prospectors have been unable to find new sources of gold. With the depletion of most veins, we must now turn to our secondary exports: Iron.

Assume ownership of the Southern Prince Edward Islands

The Southern Prince Edward Islands are an Archipelago consisting of two small islands in the sub-antarctic Indian Ocean, one named Marion Island and the other Prince Edward Island, and have been frequented by whalers and sealers since its discovery in the late 17th century. Though not possessing any noteworthy resources or any strategic value whatsoever, $COUNTRY$ is in a favorable position to assume ownership of these islands.
Assume ownership of the Crozet, Kerguelen, Amsterdam & St. Paul Islands

The Crozet, Kerguelen, Amsterdam & St. Paul Islands are several archipelagoes scattered in the sub-antarctic Indian Ocean and have been frequented by whalers and sealers since their discovery in the 18th century. Though not possessing any noteworthy resources or any strategic value whatsoever, $COUNTRY$ is in a favorable position to assume ownership of these archipelagoes.
Assume ownership of the Bouvet Island

The Bouvet Island is a remote island located in the South Atlantic Ocean, though first spotted in the 18th century, the inaccurate coordinates recorded for this island led several expeditions to fail to find the island again until 1808. Though claimed and renamed several times by different nations, Bouvet island remains uninhabited to this very day, and colonization might prove difficult due to its rough terrain… The island does not possess any noteworthy resources or any strategic value whatsoever, but $COUNTRY$ is in a favorable position to assume ownership of this island after a successful scientific expedition, led by one of $CAPITAL$'s most esteemed intellectuals, landed on the island.

In the 19th century the importance of Selangor greatly increased by the rapid expansion of tin mining as a result of the increased demand for tin from the West. The desire to control the Klang Valley led directly to the Selangor Civil War (also called the Klang War) when Raja Mahdi fought to regain what he considered his birthright as territorial chief against Raja Abdullah. In $YEAR$ however, a ship from Penang was attacked by pirates near Kuala Langat, Selangor. After a number of piracy attacks took place in Selangor, a $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Resident was assigned as a live-in advisor to Sultan Abdul Samad, making the rule a mere puppet.

In $YEAR$, the Sultan of Perak went to $CAPITAL$ seeking the recognition from the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ $MONARCHTITLE$ on his sultanate sovereignty over Perak. The Sultanate was shaken by the threat of a civil war and our military could help stabilize it. By accepting the Sultan's request and signing a friendship treaty, we will be able to establish a protectorate over Perak.

As the Johor Empire was falling apart with the loss of the Riau-Lingga territories, Temenggung Ibrahim of Johor understood this situation and quickly signed a treaty with Bendahara Tun Mutahir of Pahang. The treaty recognizes the territories of Johor (mainland), the Temenggung and his descendent's right to rule it, mutual protection and mutual recognitions of Pahang and Johor. With the signing of this treaty, the remnants of the Empire became two independent states, Johor and Pahang. Later, Pahang was fought over in a civil war between the two sons of the reigning Bendahara of Pahang. The war ended when Wan Ahmad was proclaimed the new sultan in $YEAR$, but his role from that point onward was largely ceremonial, as the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ forced him to sign a treaty bringing the country under control of a $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Resident.

In $YEAR$, the Sultan of Johor went to $CAPITAL$ seeking the recognition from the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ $MONARCHTITLE$ on his sultanate and Johor's independence. The Sultanate was shaken by civil war, internal strife and succession crisis. The once powerful sultanate is now a shell of its former self, weak and shaken. By accepting the Sultan's request and signing a friendship treaty and formally crowning him as the Sultan of Johor, we will be able to establish a protectorate over Johor.
Bouvet Island is rightfully $COUNTRY_ADJ$, and should use $COUNTRY_ADJ$ names.
Bouvet Island is rightfully $COUNTRY_ADJ$, and should use $COUNTRY_ADJ$ names.

Located in the sub-antarctic Indian Ocean, the Kerguelen or Desolation Islands, are among the most isolated places on Earth and possess a raw and chilly climate with frequent high winds throughout whole the year. Upon researching more about its history, $COUNTRY_ADJ$'s top historians discovered that several decades ago France had started a coal mining operation on the island, but abandoned it soon after due to its inaccessibility… The idea of establishing a penal colony on this archipelago began to be heard among our top politicians several days later, arguing that its inaccessibility as well as its rough climate might be suitable for a coal mining operation employing $COUNTRY$'s most dangerous prisoners.

The remove Bouvet Island has been formally annexed by $FROMCOUNTRY$ after having sent a geological and oceanographic expedition to explore the island. Though only nominally claimed in 1825 by Captain George Norris in the name of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Crown, the sighting of Bouvet and several other phantom islands mate it difficult to pinpoint its location on any sea charts, remaining unvisited until $YEAR$. We can pressure $FROMCOUNTRY$ to recognize our claims on the island, as $COUNTRY$ was technically the first country to ever claim it.
We must exhort the owner of Bouvet Island to recognize the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ claims over it. The sovereignty of $COUNTRY$ is at stake!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ protests the annexation of Bouvet Island!

$FROMCOUNTRY$ wishes to subject our claims on Bouvet Island to arbitration. Historically, they were the first country to claim the island, but the sighting of several different phantom islands and the inaccuracy of the charted sea around made it impossible for other navigators to find the islands again until $YEAR$, invalidating any $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ on Bouvet. According to our top international lawyers, any arbitrations made to contest Bouvet would be illegal.
Welcome their proposition, but state the historical fact which invalidates any $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ claims
Refuse, Bouvet is rightfully $COUNTRY_ADJ$ and it shall remain like so

While the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$s welcome our proposition, they state that any claims laid on the island are invalid due to the inaccuracy of the charted sea surrounding it and the sighting of several other phantom islands during Norris' voyage. $FROMCOUNTRY$ exhorts us to abandon all claims on the island, as any arbitration would be illegal according to international law.
Then $COUNTRY$ must abandon all claims on Bouvet.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ refuses to acknowledge any $COUNTRY_ADJ$ claims on Bouvet and shall continue exploiting its water as they seem fit.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided to abandon all claims laid on Bouvet.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided to keep pressing their claims on Bouvet.
Why must they always do this?
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided to abandon all claims laid on Marabitanas.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided to reject our proposition, keeping all their claims on Marabitanas.

The jungles surrounding the Aquiri Basin lie in the heart of the Amazon and should rightfully belong to $COUNTRY$. Currently there are $COUNTRY_ADJ$settlers eager for the opportunity to settle the region and have asked for the funds to assist them, though advisors say this may cause problems with neighboring states who also claim the territory.
An unexpected wave of immigrants from $FROMCOUNTRY$!
The jugles surrounding the Aquiri Basin are experiencing a huge influx of $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$s, who we suspect have been sent there by their government.

The jungles surrounding the Aquiri Basin lie in the heart of the Amazon and should rightfully belong to $COUNTRY$. Currently there are $COUNTRY_ADJ$settlers eager for the opportunity to settle the region and have asked for the funds to assist them, though advisors say this may cause problems with neighboring states who also claim the territory.
Ignore Aquiri. It's not worth it.

Talks to be held in Bolivia and initiated by the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government aim to end tensions over the region known as the Aquiri Basin, claimed by multiple countries, as well as the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ claims in the Bolivian Mato Grosso. The proper demarcation of borders in the Aquiri and Mato Grosso will take place and hopefully this will be the final border issue between the involved parties.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government wishes to hold talks to end tensions over the region known as the Aquiri Basin, claimed by multiple countries, themselves included. $FROMCOUNTRY$, is now offering us a friendship treaty in exchange for us dropping any claims as well as seceding part of the territory claimed by $FROMCOUNTRY$. What shall we do about it?
We must strive for the proper delimitation of our borders.
$FROMCOUNTRY$simply wants our territories, reject their proposition.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed to sign the treaty!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused to sign the treaty!

For about forty years now, the Aquiri Basin has been overrun by Brazilians who made up the vast majority of the civilized population. The territory of Tarauaca was assigned to $COUNTRY$ in 1867 by the Treaty of Ayacucho which was signed with Brazil, but due to the increasing prices of rubber, the region has been attracting more Brazilians than ever before. Trouble brewed in the area when finally in $YEAR$, the Spanish journalist and former diplomat Luis Gálvez Rodríguez de Arias led an expedition that sought to seize control of Tarauaca from Bolivia. The expedition was secretly financed by the government of the Brazilian state of Amazonas and aimed to incorporate Tarauaca into Brazil after declaring its independence from $COUNTRY$. Gálvez declared himself president of the Republic of Acre and set up his capital at the town of Puerto Alonso, which he renamed Porto Acre.
We will support them! (Play as Acre)

For about forty years now, the Aquiri Basin has been overrun by $COUNTRY_ADJ$s who made up the vast majority of the civilized population. The territory of Tarauaca was assigned to $FROMCOUNTRY$ in 1867 by the Treaty of Ayacucho which was signed with $COUNTRY$, but due to the increasing prices of rubber, the region has been attracting more $COUNTRY_ADJ$s than ever before. Trouble brewed in the area when finally in $YEAR$, the Spanish journalist and former diplomat Luis Gálvez Rodríguez de Arias led an expedition that sought to seize control of Tarauaca from Bolivia. The expedition was secretly financed by the government of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$state of Amazonas and aimed to incorporate Tarauaca into Brazil after declaring its independence from $FROMCOUNTRY$. Gálvez declared himself president of the Republic of Acre and set up his capital at the town of Puerto Alonso, which he renamed Porto Acre. Several statesmen have suggested supporting the endeavors of President Gálvez, but doing so might upset our relations with $FROMCOUNTRY$…
An interesting development, but we cannot approve of this.
We can surely benefit from this…
We will support them! (Play as Acre)
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed to sign the treaty!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused to sign the treaty!

Talks to be held in $CAPITAL$ and initiated by the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government aim to end tensions over the Peruvian claims in the Amazon. The proper demarcation of borders will take place and hopefully this will be the final border issue between the involved parties.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government wishes to hold talks to end tensions over the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ claims in the Amazon. $FROMCOUNTRY$, is now offering us a Definitive Treaty of Limits, in which they will allow free navigation of the Amazonian basin as well as a Treaty of Frienship, in exchange for us dropping any claims on their territory. What shall we do about it?
We must strive for the proper delimitation of our borders.
$FROMCOUNTRY$simply wants our territories, reject their proposition.
The Treaty of Velarde-Río Branco, $FROMCOUNTRY$'s response
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed to sign the treaty!
The Treaty of Velarde-Río Branco, $FROMCOUNTRY$'s response
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused to sign the treaty!
Taking over the Republic of Acre

The original intentions of Gálvez were to annex Acre to $COUNTRY$, and as such, it is our duty to fulfill his desires now that the moods have calmed down in the area. The first step is to turn their government into our loyal puppet.
The Republic of Acre lies firmly under our grasp, and it must be annexed to $COUNTRY$ as it was originally intended. Their proposed territorial claims will also be inherited by $COUNTRY$.

The border between Bolivia and Argentina has long been under influence of Caudillos from both countries, the provinces being raided and conquered numerous times. The Bolivians conquered Yavi, an Argentine province, using the attempt to stop Argentinian Caudillos from raiding Bolivia's countryside as the justification. After the recent war the Argentine took Yavi and Tarija, the latter being claimed by some Argentine northern Caudillos as being part of Argentina but that province long has been under the rule of Bolivia and has mainly a Bolivian population. Now with the post-war peace talks, our diplomats proposed that we raise the question of the settlement of the borders between Bolivia and Argentina. The best deal we can get by our diplomats calculations is to offer to renounce all our claims in Jujuy and Salta in exchange for the return of Yavi and Tarija and their renouncement of their claims in those provinces.
We will not renounce our claims.

Both $COUNTRY$ and Bolivia possess historical claims over the province of Tarija which have been inherited from the former Viceroyalty of Rio de la Plata’s overlapping and poorly-defined jurisdictions of their respective Archbishoprics. Several decades ago, $COUNTRY$ renounced to these claims after signing a treaty with the Bolivians, however, said treaty was fomented by local caudillos who swore no true allegation to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ nation nor Bolivia and simply wished to maintain their status quo in the remote provinces of the Salta, Tarija and the Puna, left to their own anarchic devices. Most of these caudillos are alive no longer and ever since Bolivia’s defeat on the Pacific War, their hold on the remote southern provinces of their nation has been degrading rapidly. We could use this situation to our advantage by employing historical pretexts in order to relinquish our old claims on Tarija.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided to relinquish their claims on Tarija, basing their pretext on the historical overlapping Archbishoprics in the former Viceroyalty of Rio de la Plata as well as the nulity of the Bolivian-Argentine Border Treaty due to its main signers being caudillos who simply wished to protect their personal interests.

Bolivia’s current political climate is astonishingly turbulent, something $COUNTRY$ could make use of in hopes for obtaining territorial gains. Minister Norberto Quirno Costa proposes coercing Bolivians into signing a treaty, in utmost secrecy from the Chilean Government, recognizing $COUNTRY_ADJ$ claims over the currently-disputed territories of the Puna de Atacama. However, these claims might not come free, and $COUNTRY$ might have to give up something in return: The Tarija. By giving up our historical claims on Tarija, Bolivia might accept recognizing our claims on the Puna, a remote region which has been under Chilean occupation since the War of the Pacific, surely a thorn on Bolivia’s side. We might come in conflict with Chile in the future, but their current political situation is also very precarious, which might grant us the opportunity to annex the iron-rich region of the Puna all for ourselves.
The Quirno Costa-Vaca Guzmán Treaty of $YEAR$

$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Minister Norberto Quirno Costa wishes to strike a deal with us: By renouncing to their claims on Tarija, they want $COUNTRY$ to recognize their claims on the Puna de Atacama, a region which is currently under Chilean occupation. Surely their moves are ulterior, but $COUNTRY$ could also obtain something from all this, states our Envoy to $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Mr. Santiago Vaca Guzmán, perhaps fomenting border frictions between Chile and $COUNTRY$ might be a good idea in the current political climate, which might just give us the opportunity to snatch the Puna and the Atacama Littoral back to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ hands.
It must be done, close the deal.
We cannot allow the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$s to lay claims over our sovereignty!
The Quirno Costa-Vaca Guzmán Treaty of $YEAR$, $FROMCOUNTRY$'s response
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has accepted to recognize our claims over the Puna in exchange of abandoning Tarija.
The Quirno Costa-Vaca Guzmán Treaty of $YEAR$, $FROMCOUNTRY$'s response
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused to recognize our claims over the Puna in exchange of abandoning Tarija.

After the completion of our campaigns in the Atacama Littoral, $COUNTRY$ obtained sizeable territorial gains from countries that have been quite a bit hostile to us in the past. The War of the Pacific only increased this enmity and now $COUNTRY$shares a land border with Peru, something which places the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ nation in quite the precarious position. Our Minister for Foreign Affairs, Luis Barros Borgoño, has given our $MONARCHTITLE$ quite a peculiar proposition to solve any further boundary issues with the Peruvians: Granting the ports of Tacna and Arica to the now landlocked nation of Bolivia in exchange of the abandonment of their claims on the Puna de Atacama, as well as the formalization and ratification of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ ownership of these territories. Without a shared border with Peru, as well as the abandonment of any territories claimed by them, $COUNTRY$ will have one less problem to take care of in the future.

$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Minister for Foreign Affairs, Luis Barros Borgoño, has arrived in $COUNTRY$ with quite a peculiar proposition: A treaty to formally recognize $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ ownership of the Puna de Atacama, and abandoning any $COUNTRY_ADJ$ claims over the region, in exchange of the secession of the ports of Tacna and Arica to $COUNTRY$. While many of our Statesmen have been outraged by such proposition, our Plenipotentiary Minister, Heriberto Gutiérrez, has argued that giving up the remote and scarcely-populated region of the Puna for two seaports in the Pacific might be very beneficial for our nation.
It must be done, ratify this treaty.
Outrageous, the Puna de Atacama is rightfully $COUNTRY_ADJ$ and it shall remain so!
The Barros Borgoño-Gutiérrez Treaty of $YEAR$, $FROMCOUNTRY$'s response
$FROMCOUNTRY$ is willing to ratify the treaty.
The Barros Borgoño-Gutiérrez Treaty of $YEAR$, $FROMCOUNTRY$'s response
$FROMCOUNTRY$ is outraged by our proposition and their Plenipotentiary Minister wishes to make our $MONARCHTITLE$ that the Puna will always be $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$.
They're welcome to try and take it.

Dardo Rocha, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ envoy for Bolivia, suggests that $COUNTRY$ should reaffirm her claims on the Puna de Atacama after the aftermath that came from the Quirno Costa-Vaca Guzmán Treaty, which was signed in secrecy from the Chilean government. Bolivia should also be extorted to abandon all claims on the Puna if they so wish to remain outside any future conflicts with our nation, as well as with the Chileans… Their country is in a very precarious state, and Mr. Dardo Rocha believes this should help ease any tensions with out northwestern neighbor.

Dardo Rocha, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ envoy for $COUNTRY$, wishes to reaffirm $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ claims on the Puna and also exhorts our Minister for Foreign Affairs, Mr. Emeterio Cano, to abandon all $COUNTRY$ claims in the Puna de Atacama if our nation wishes to remain outside any future confrontations with $FROMCOUNTRY$ and Chile over the aforementioned territories.
A sensible proposition, sign the protocol.
$COUNTRY$ will never give up on the Puna!
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$s wish to sign the protocol.
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$s refuse to sign the protocol.
The Litigation of the Puna of Atacama

The Puna de Atacama issue appears to have come to a stalemate after Bolivia abandoned all its claims on the region, with neither of the current involved parties willing to cede an inch on their dispute. This ordeal has to end if the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ nation is to move forward, we must urge the other party to accept a foreign litigation of the Puna issue, lest our nations devolve into pointless wars for the decades to come.
The Litigation of the Puna of Atacama

The Puna de Atacama issue appears to have come to a stalemate after Bolivia abandoned all its claims on the region, with neither of the current involved parties willing to cede an inch on their dispute. $FROMCOUNTRY$ is urging us to accept a foreign litigation of the Puna issue, lest our nations devolve into pointless wars for the decades to come.
We cannot accept foreigners meddling in $COUNTRY_ADJ$ issues.
The Litigation of the Puna of Atacama, $FROMCOUNTRY$'s response
$FROMCOUNTRY$ wishes to subject the Puna Dispute to an international court. Our arbiter should be contacted shortly…
The Litigation of the Puna of Atacama, $FROMCOUNTRY$'s response
$FROMCOUNTRY$ refuses to subject the Puna Dispute to an international court, stating that they cannot accept any foreigners meddling in $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ issues.
The Litigation of the Puna of Atacama

One of the aftermaths of the War of the Pacific between Chile, Bolivia and Peru was the Chilean occupation of the Puna de Atacama, a territory they now contest with Argentina after Bolivia abandoned all their claims on the region. $FROMCOUNTRY$ has formally requested us, $COUNTRY$, to serve as an arbiter and settle this territorial issues once and for all lest the region devolves into a chain of pointless punitive wars for the decades to come…
Grant Rincón to Chile and the rest of the Puna to Argenina.
Favor Chile with all the contested territories.
Favor Argentina with all the contested territories.
The Litigation of the Puna of Atacama, $FROMCOUNTRY$'s Arbitration
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided to grant the Rincón province to $COUNTRY$ and the rest shall be kept by Argentina.
The Litigation of the Puna of Atacama, $FROMCOUNTRY$'s Arbitration
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided to grant the Rincón province to Chile and the rest shall be kept by $COUNTRY$.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided to favor Chile with all the contested territories.

We must choose a culture representing our union!

Rio Grande del Sur is rightfully $COUNTRY_ADJ$, and should use $COUNTRY_ADJ$ names.

From the Old World to the New

Keep, ancient lands, your storied pomp! cries she
With silent lips. "Give me your tired, your poor,
Your huddled masses yearning to breathe free,
The wretched refuse of your teeming shore.
Send these, the homeless, tempest-tost to me,
I lift my lamp beside the golden door!"
After 1880 larger steam-powered oceangoing ships replaced sailing ships, which resulted in lower fares and greater immigrant mobility. Meanwhile, farming improvements in Southern Europe and the Russian Empire created surplus labor. This wave of migration, constituting the third episode in the history of North American immigration, may be better referred to as a flood of immigrants, as nearly 25 million Europeans made the long trip.
Alaska is rightfully $COUNTRY_ADJ$, and should use $COUNTRY_ADJ$ names.
