Building a canal which will link the Baltic Sea with the White Sea would be a tremendous boon to our shipping, and we are in a position to build one.
We own the Baltic-White Sea Canal, linking the Baltic Sea and the White Sea, and we receive the dividends of its toll and glory for its possession.

A combination of commercial and naval interests have led $COUNTRY$ to the idea of constructing an artificial waterway that'd allow vessels to travel from the Baltic Sea to the White Sea. The 141 miles long canal is being built and is expected to quickly become a busy artificial waterway. The project offers new impetus to commerce for Northern Norway and Arkhangelesk, and proves that nation's greatness can be achieved through manufacture, trade and engineering rather than through war and conquest.

The 141 miles long canal is being built and is expected to quickly become a very busy artificial waterway. The project offers new impetus to commerce for Northern Norway and Arkhangelesk, and proves that nation's greatness can be achieved through manufacture, trade and engineering rather than through war and conquest.

The 141 miles long Baltic-White Sea Canal is being built and it is expected to quickly become a very busy artificial waterway. The project offers new impetus to commerce for Northern Norway and Arkhangelesk.
Construction of the Baltic-White Sea Canal

Today we will start building the Canal to bring access to the White Sea from the Baltic Sea. Our engineers are ready and a series of surveys of the area of the canal were done. The only thing left to do before we start the construction is define the budget of this colossal project. \n \n This promises to be one massive undertaking and when finished it will be, without a doubt, one of the biggest human achievements for decades to come.
Allow them to have as much money as they need.
Invest a little more than they asked for.
Give them as much as they asked for.
We shall give them permission to use prisoners instead.
The Construction of the Baltic-White Sea Canal is Finished

The canal took years and thousands of workers to be built but today on $YEAR$, the canal was officially opened by the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ ruler for transiting from St. Petersburg to Kostomuksha. The next day, a ceremony was held in Kostomuksha where the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ ruler laid the final stone.

Pocutsia was a historical area on the borderlands of the old Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, which at one point became the feudal property of the Princes of Moldavia within the Commonwealth. Centered around the town of Colomeea, or Kolomea in German, the area is to this very day still inhabited by Romanians. Although culturally diverse, it rightfully belongs to $COUNTRY_ADJ$, more so than Austria, Poland or Russia, regardless of the international community's opinion on the matter.

Camenitsa and Ciortkiv are cities in Podolia and while historically never being under the suzerainty of any Moldavian, Wallachian or Transylvanian Princes, both areas have been inhabited by Romanian peoples since time immemorial. By using an elaborate diplomatic scheme, we could claim them as our territories, for the wellbeing of every Romanian living there.
As one of the most powerful Georgian Kingdoms, we are in position to lay claim over Georgia, in hopes for finally reuniting all Georgians in what once was the United Kingdom of Georgia.
As one of the most powerful Azeri Khanates, we are in position to lay claim over Azerbaijan, in hopes for finally reuniting all Azerbaijanis on both sides of the Russo-Persian border.

Eastern Armenia housed the last quasi-independent Armenian realm, the Melikdoms of Khamsa, our nation. With a rich Armenian tradition, but filled with many foreigners claiming our territories as their own, Eastern Armenia has been the battlefield of Empires for hundreds of years. But we say no more, Eastern Armenia shall belong to the Armenians now, tomorrow and forever after.

For hundreds of years, the Armenian people didn't have an independent country to call their own, but we say no more, as the United Melikdoms of Khamsa, it is our duty to reform the government in order to become a new realm, one which will end the sizeable Armenian diaspora once and for all, a country for those Armenians who have been living under foreign dominion for so long, they almost forgot the customs of their homeland… We shall become a United Armenian Realm for Western, Eastern and Diaspora Armenians, a country to call their own… And a country to repel the invaders from our rightful homeland.

For some, the Georgian Golden Age ended with the arrival of the dreaded Mongols roughly 600 years ago, but this dream is becoming more real by the day, as we are in a position to claim our ancient, rightful dominions.
It is high time for the Kazakhs of the Bukey Horde to become proper Russian subjects
The Great Game Comes to Kyzyl-Su
We must press our domination of Central Asia. This means that Kyzyl-Su must join our nation, or stand forever more subject to British aggression in the region.

We must press our domination of Central Asia. This means that Turkmenia must join our nation, or stand forever more subject to British aggression in the region.

If Kazakhs are to survive in this turbulent world, we must bond and cooperate together. Becoming the suzerains of the Bukey Horde shall make us stronger!
If Kazakhs are to survive in this turbulent world, we must bond and cooperate together. Becoming the suzerains of the Junior Jüz shall make us stronger!
If Kazakhs are to survive in this turbulent world, we must bond and cooperate together. Becoming the suzerains of the Middle Jüz shall make us stronger!
If Kazakhs are to survive in this turbulent world, we must bond and cooperate together. Becoming the suzerains of the Senior Jüz shall make us stronger!
All Kazakhs must stand together against external threats and the only way of doing so is by uniting all the tribes and reviving the Khanate of old!

Our people, originally members of the Junior Jüz, were allowed to settle west across the Ural River in order to repopulate the barren steppes. As the rightful heirs of Nur-Ali Khan, all legal claims on the Junior Jüz still stand!
The Rub' Al-Khali, or the Empty Quarter, lies untouched and forgotten, we must extend our influence to this forgotten corner of the world and claim it as our own!

For far too long has Arabistan been under our indirect suzerainty, it is time to put an end to this. The perfect oportunity has been set up to abolish this small statelet and properly bring its people to our fold.

For far too long has Anizzah been under our indirect suzerainty, it is time to put an end to this. The perfect oportunity has been set up to abolish this small statelet and properly bring its people to our fold.

Assam lies in the strategic Brahmaputra Valley, its surrounding mountains form a natural gateway for the rest of India… Given the shoddy state of affairs in Assam, its internal strife which is in no doubt caused by ourselves, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Colonial Government of India is in position to annex what is left of the ancient, and very strategic, Kingdom of Assam.
The fabled high-quality wool knowns as Pashmina is produced this province.
Our nation thrives and therefore more people flock to our cities each day.

Our policy to remove untoward elements in our country has proved successful, but new immigrants or acquisitions to the nation have not forgotten. Our core population, however, is experiencing a new state of euphoria.
We can't enact a new policy right now.
With our strict border control policy we are giving a hard time to anyone who wants to leave or come to our country.
There is a hideout of escaped slaves, Maroons, in this province, and they are causing trouble for local plantations.
A group of enterprising capitalists have formed a Progressive Society in this province, in an attempt to discredit slavery.
Slaves in this province have been reading and learning the ideas of Marx and other communist philosophers.
Factory and owners and other employers in this province have been hiring immigrants and other cheap labour, as they cost less than maintaining slaves.

Gulab Singh Jamwal, Raja of Jammu, has sent an envoy to $CAPITAL$ with a quite bold proposal: Attacking Tibet, a nation which is under the protection of the Qing Emperor, and annexing the regions of Sumdo and Purang by placing them under Jamwal suzerainty. While many have their doubts about Gulab Singh's motives, mainly taking over the lucrative Pashmina wool trade in the region, he states that by connecting the $COUNTRY$ with the Gorkha Kingdom of Nepal with a land bridge, a Sikh-Gorkha alliance could be forged which will help against very possible future British incursions. Whatever might be the case, Raja Gulab Singh Jamwal does make a fair point which cannot be easily ignored… Especially when doing so while the Qing are at their weakest might be possible.
Indeed, he does make a fair point…
Trouble brews from the Sikh Empire as they declare war on $COUNTRY$ with the pretense of annexing the Tibetan territories of Sumdo and Purang…
After conquering the territories of Sumdo and Purang, our top diplomats are suggesting we sit down with the Qing envoys in order to discuss the future of this war.
The territories of Sumdo and Purang are under our control. Now is the time to sit down with the Qing and work out a peace deal that will see them transferred into $COUNTRY_ADJ$ hands!
No! We must relinquish more loot and territories!

$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Envoys are gathering with $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Diplomats in order to discuss the outcome of this war. As $COUNTRY$ is currently going through a crisis with a major power, some of our diplomats have suggested it would be wise to let go and give them what they wish for…
Never! There will be a reckoning…
$FROMCOUNTRY$ refuses our military and diplomatic superiority, the war shall continue…
After turning back the tides of war against our Sikh aggressors, $COUNTRY$ is in a favorable position to negotiate a proper, and very beneficial, end to this pointless war.

After turning back the tides of war against our Sikh aggressors, $COUNTRY$ is in a favorable position to negotiate a proper, and very beneficial, end to this pointless war. Several of our diplomats have suggested to force the Sikh Empire to release the nation of Ladakh, who will henceforth become a $COUNTRY_ADJ$ protectorate.
No! We must relinquish more loot and territories!

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has turned the tides of war on us and are now wishing to negotiate an end to this war… Only if we are to release the newly-conquered nation of Ladakh, which will henceforth become a $FROMCOUNTRY$ protectorate.
Curse them! There will be a reckoning…
$FROMCOUNTRY$ refuses our military and diplomatic superiority, the war shall continue…
We shall promptly become Qing's protectorate.
After turning back the tides of war against our Sikh aggressors, $COUNTRY$ is in a favorable position to negotiate a proper, and very beneficial, end to this pointless war.

After turning back the tides of war against our Sikh aggressors, $COUNTRY$ is in a favorable position to negotiate a proper, and very beneficial, end to this pointless war. Several of our diplomats have suggested to forge a secret alliance with the Sikh and fight alongside them to attain freedom from our Chinese oppressors, others suggest $COUNTRY$ should relinquish old claims in the territories held by the defunct nation of Ladakh… It is time to decide the outcome of this war…
We must fight Qing with our new allies!
None, we must relinquish more loot and territories!

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has turned the tides of war on us and are now wishing to negotiate an end to their side of the war… They wish to forge a secret alliance with us at the back of the Qing Emperor, and with our help, to regain their freedom… Indeed they shall prove a valuable ally against future British incursions, but the cost of fighting the Qing might be quite high.
Never! There shall be a reckoning!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has accepted our terms and have agreed to help us in the upcoming war against Qing.
The Sikh and the Tibetans have forged an alliance against us, betraying our mandate of heaven, the Tibetan dogs have decided to rebel against Qing Authority!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ refuses to help us! The war shall continue

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has turned the tides of war on us and are now wishing to negotiate an end to the war… They wish to relinquish some ancient and very doubtful claims on the territories of the defunct Kingdom of Ladakh, mainly the provinces of Leh and Skardu which are inhabited by their close kin.
Never! There shall be a reckoning!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has accepted our terms and has agreed to transfer the provinces to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ control.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ refuses our terms! The war shall continue…

After the current war has dragged on for far too long, $COUNTRY$ is beginning to feel its effect on the general populace, this, coupled with external threats from the British Empire, has put our nation on a very precarious position. We must do something about this… And our diplomats feel the opposing side of this war is also looking forward to do the same…
Never! There shall be a reckoning!

After the current war has dragged on for far too long, $COUNTRY$ is beginning to feel its effect on the general populace, this, coupled with external threats from the British Empire, has put our nation on a very precarious position. In a secret meeting, $COUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats, as well as those from the opposing side of the war, are negotiating what is called in the western world a Status Quo Ante Bellum, or the withdrawal of any and all troops and the restoration of prewar leadership…
Never! There shall be a reckoning!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has accepted the terms of a Status Quo Ante Bellum…
$FROMCOUNTRY$ deems its best interest to continue this pointless war…

Our Prime Minister, Jung Bahadur Kunwar Rana, has denounced a harsh mistreatment of Nepalese merchants and diplomats in the neighboring nation of Tibet upon the death of the sixth Panchen Lama, which happened not long ago… He states that if Nepal is to be taken as a serious nation, Tibet must pay for these grievances whether in blood, gold or land. The recent troubles our Qing overlord has been going through could be easily exploited to build up a casus belli and declare war on our northen neighbors, and the small border dispute of the Tsongdu, called Kuti in Nepalese, could be used as the detonant for such war.
Indeed, the nation of Tibet must pay…
Now is not the time to attack our neighbor.
Never! Tibet is one of Nepal's greatest allies!

Prime Minister Jung Bahadur Kunwar Rana of Nepal has declared war on Tibet, citing a harsh mistreatment of Nepalese merchants and diplomats and a border dispute on Tsongdu, among other grievances, which should be paid in utmost urgency.

The war with Nepal has dragged on for far too long, and as our country is drowning in threats both internal and external, the top $COUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats are suggesting we mediate peace between the Nepalese and the Tibetans.

The war with Nepal has dragged on for far too long, and as our country is drowning in threats both internal and external, the top $COUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats are suggesting we mediate peace between the Nepalese and the Tibetans. Nepal must pay Tibet for its war grievances, but only after Tibet does apologize for the mistreatment of Nepalese nationals. Top $COUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats have already drafted a peace treaty, which ought to be signed in the Thapathali Palace of Kathmandu.
Never! We can still win this war!
Nepal is too troublesome, let it free instead.
Let Nepal and Tibet solve their differences by freeing them from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Suzerainty.

As per suggested by the Qing Emperor, this war has dragged on for far too long and something must be done about it. The Qing are looking to mediate a peace treaty between Nepal and Tibet. Nepal must pay Tibet for any grievances causes by the war, but only after Tibet does apologize for the mistreatment of Nepalese nationals by signing a friendship treaty with Nepal, Nepal must also renounce to all claims on Tibetan soil and lastly: Tibet and Nepal shall agree to regard the Chinese Emperor as the sovereign. All seems well and good, shall we ratify the treaty?
Qing decides to let Nepal free!
Proven to be too difficult to handle, the Chinese have decided to end their suzerainty to Nepal.
Qing decides to let Nepal free!
Proven to be too difficult to handle, the Chinese have decided to end their suzerainty on Nepal.
Qing decides to let Nepal and Tibet free!

Proven to be too difficult to handle, the Chinese have decided to end their suzerainty on Nepal and Tibet. Instead, the Qing have let them both solve their differences without supporting either country.
Nepal has decided to ratify the Treaty of Thapathali, which shall end the ongoing war between Tibet and Nepal.

In 1835 the Governor General of the East India Company acquired the hill tracts of Darjeeling, leased by the Chogyal of $COUNTRY$, to build a sanitorium for their sick residents. The British Resident desires to know if the Chogyal wishes to keep leasing the territory of Darjeeling, as payment of 6000 Pounds is due to arrive shortly.
No, we want our territories back.

In 1835 the Governor General of the East India Company acquired the hill tracts of Darjeeling, leased by the Chogyal of $COUNTRY$, to build a sanitorium for their sick residents. The Chogyal of Sikkim desires to know if the British Resident wishes to keep the territory of Darjeeling.
No, we have no use for such backwater country.

In 1835 the Governor General of the East India Company acquired the hill tracts of Darjeeling, leased by the Chogyal of $COUNTRY$, to build a sanitorium for their sick residents. The Chogyal of Sikkim desires his lease back, shall we give it to him? Due to a legal loophole in our contract, we can press colonial claims on the area even if we give it back.
Then give it back, we'll take it by force.
Just give it back, I don't care.
The British have decided to lease the territory once more!
The British don't want the territories anymore… We shall be gaining control of the area soon.
The British have decided to give our territories back, but they warn that due to a legal loophole in the contract, they can take it back from us by force and international recognition.
The British have decided to give our territories back just like that, we should consider ourselves lucky.
The Darjeeling lease has been renewed!
The Darjeeling lease has been renewed!

In 1835 the Governor-General of India, Lord William Bentinck, acquired Darjeeling on a lease from the Kingdom of Sikkim in order to build a Sanitorium and a Trade Hub. The Sanitorium itself has brought people from all over the area to work the fields and do commerce. This province is currently thriving.
The British have decided not to give our rightful territory back!
Curse them and their royal house!
In 1841 Tea was brought to the region by the local administration and soon enough many tea estates started opperating commercially.
High-quality, silky smooth Pashmina wool is currently being produced in this province.

In 1835 the Governor-General of India, Lord William Bentinck, acquired Darjeeling on a lease from the Kingdom of Sikkim in order to build a Sanitorium and a Trade Hub. The Sanitorium itself has brought people from all over the area to work the fields and do commerce. This province is currently thriving.

The recent development of Darjeeling as a regional seat of commerce has brought many Sikkimese labourers there, often leaving their jobs in Sikkim for a better life as British subjects on that leased territory. This has greatly displeased the Sikkimese nobility, who are doing everything in their power to prevent the free peasantry from leaving.
Let them do as they please. They'll be back, I'm sure.
Make an example out of those who want to leave!

Guards from a local Dzong have spotted a party of foreigners of British origin camping in the forests near Tumlong. Normally we'd expell them using force, but the guards report two important people among the foreigners, some Joseph Dalton Hooker, renowned in his homeland, and Dr. Archibald Campbell, Superintendent of Darjeeling no less… My Chogyal, the nobles are greatly displeased by this intrusion and demand these foreigners to be apprehended. What shall we do?
Apprehend and ask for a ransom, of course.
Let them be, they're more trouble than they're worth.

Dr. Archibald Campbell, Superintendent of Darjeeling, and Sir Joseph Dalton Hooker are captured in Sikkim while doing a botanical research expedition! The Chogyal of Sikkim is asking for a hefty ransom of ten-thousand pounds in exchange of their return, citing a clause in their local laws which states that all foreigners must have permission from the Chogyal to enter Sikkim! What shall we do?
The $FROMCOUNTRY$ demands the immediate release of Dr. Archibald Campbell and Sir Joseph Dalton Hooker, or else there will be grave consequences.
They have to pay up first.
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have decided to pay for Dr. Campbell and Sir Hooker's release.
The Chogyal of Sikkim has caved in to our demands and has released Dr. Campbell and Sir Hooker! They're now safe and sound!
The Chogyal of Sikkim won't release Dr. Campbell and Sir Hooker unless a ransom is paid!
Then we shall get them back by force!

Recent actions from the Chogyal of Sikkim have upset many in Darjeeling and India overall, especially the ransom placed upon our very esteemed Dr. Campbell and Sir Hooker. Proper reprisal must be enforced if the statelets of India and the Himalayas are to respect British Authority. We shall stop all payments for the lease of Darjeeling while also permanently incorporating that territory into our East Indies Company.

Enraged by the kidnapping of Dr. Campbell and Sir Hooker, the British have decided to stop all lease payments for the territory of Darjeeling… They shall also appropriate of said territory as reprisal for our actions.
Curse the bastards! Darjeeling is not yet lost…

Darjeeling, a territory which rightfully belongs to $COUNTRY$, has been deceitfully taken away by the British. For this, we must retaliate in the only way possible: By raiding our rightful territories and by fomenting sedition among the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people living there.

Recent roving bands of highwaymen and other scum have been hitting the province of Darjeeling, no doubt Sikkim has got their hands in this, as we know they simply cannot stand to lose their old territory. The people of Darjeeling are very upset about these brigands… Some of them even talk about revolting against our rule and going back to the Chogyal's fold!
Brigands are constantly raiding this province.
Brigands are constantly raiding this province.
Sikkimese aggression against the good people of Darjeeling has been going on for far too long, it is time to put an end to this.
The Evil British Empire has declared Sikkim their enemy and is now wishing to wage war against the good Chogyal and enslave his people like they've done with the Rajas of India…
How can we even stop them?

The junction in time between the end of one rulers reign and the start of another is always a period uncertainty: A period of time of seeing whether the authority of the new ruler will be accepted. Here, at the start of Naser al-Din's reign, two noblemen -Hasah Khan Salar and Ja'far Quli Khan Kurd- have raised the banner of insurrection and are attempting to establish their own fief around Mashhad.\n\nHaving raised their own private army of Turkmen tribesmen, the unsuspected citizens of Mashhad invited Hasah Khan Salat and Ja'far Quli into the city with an eye of quelling ongoing riots. Instead of quelling the riots, though, they turned their attention towards the citadel held by the loyal governor. While the citadel held for some time, it was not supplied to sustain a siege. The governor had no option but to retire and leave the city to the rebels!

After we gained gained control of Lower Assam in 1826, tensions with Bhutan began to rise as we inevitably exerted our strength in the region. Bhutanese payments of annual tribute for the Assam Duars gradually fell into arrears. Our demands for proper compensation led to the military incursions into Bhutan in 1834 and 1835, resulting in defeat for Bhutan's forces and a temporary loss of territory. It is so that in $YEAR$, the governor general of the East India Company has brought a proposal for Bhutan Issue: The annexation of the Goalpara Duars, as territorial compensation for our losses, in exchange of a hefty payment of ten thousand pounds.

After we gained gained control of Lower Assam in 1826, tensions with Bhutan began to rise as we inevitably exerted our strength in the region. Bhutanese payments of annual tribute for the Assam Duars gradually fell into arrears. Our demands for proper compensation led to the military incursions into Bhutan in 1834 and 1835, resulting in defeat for Bhutan's forces and a temporary loss of territory. It is so that in $YEAR$, the governor general of the East India Company has brought a proposal for the Bhutanese Issue: The annexation of the Goalpara Duars, as territorial compensation for our losses, in exchange of a hefty payment of ten thousand pounds.
Propose the Annexation, double the sum and include the Kokhrajar Duars
We don't have time for this…

After the British gained gained control of Lower Assam in 1826, tensions with Bhutan began to rise as they inevitably exerted their strength in the region. Bhutanese payments of annual tribute for the Assam Duars gradually fell into arrears. British demands for proper compensation led to the military incursions into Bhutan in 1834 and 1835, resulting in defeat for our forces and a temporary loss of territory. It is so that in $YEAR$, the governor general of the East India Company has brought a proposal for Bhutan: The annexation of the Goalpara Duars to the East India Company, as territorial compensation for British losses, in exchange of a hefty payment of ten thousand pounds. Shall we accept Your Holiness? The Duars in general are an unruly province and have proven to be difficult to manage properly…
Indeed. We shall compensate for their losses.

After the British gained gained control of Lower Assam in 1826, tensions with Bhutan began to rise as they inevitably exerted their strength in the region. Bhutanese payments of annual tribute for the Assam Duars gradually fell into arrears. British demands for proper compensation led to the military incursions into Bhutan in 1834 and 1835, resulting in defeat for our forces and a temporary loss of territory. It is so that in $YEAR$, the governor general of the East India Company has brought a proposal for Bhutan: The annexation of the Goalpara and Kokhraja Duars to the East India Company, as territorial compensation for British losses, in exchange of a hefty payment of twenty thousand pounds. Shall we accept Your Holiness? The Duars in general are an unruly province and have proven to be difficult to manage properly…
Indeed. We shall compensate for their losses.
The Bhutanese have refused our offer!
Most, if not all, Penlops and Dzongpens in our country are quasi-independent lords of their own realms.
A price to pay for our superiority…

As the country still stands disunited and under the constant threat of British intervention, the Penlop of Trongsa must request more authority over his own realm and the Dzongpons we rule. If our request goes unheeded, we shall give an ultimatum to the Druk Desi in Punakha: Prepare for war.
The Penlop of Trongsa requests more autonomy!

As the country still stands disunited and under the constant threat of British intervention, the Penlop of Trongsa requests -under threat of civil war- more authority over the Dzongpens he's ruling over and autonomy over his realm.
Grant it, we must avoid war!
Never! It will be decided on the battlefield.
The Penlop of Trongsa requests more autonomy!
The Druk Desi of Punakha has accepted our request!
The Penlop of Trongsa requests more autonomy!
The Druk Desi of Punakha has refused to grant us more autonomy!

The Dzongpen of Punakha has set up a rival Druk Desi -the secular administrative ruler of a Tibetan-styled Diarchy- and declared the current Druk Desi a pretender! The Current Druk Desi has sought refuge with the Penlop of Paro, and now with our nation even more divided, we are at the verge of a civil war! One thing remains, however, the Penlop of Trongsa hasn't chosen a side… yet.
This shall be decided on the battlefield!

The Dzongpen of Punakha has set up a rival Druk Desi -the secular administrative ruler of a Tibetan-styled Diarchy- and declared the current Druk Desi a pretender! The Current Druk Desi has sought refuge with the Penlop of Paro, and now with our nation even more divided, we are at the verge of a civil war! One thing remains, however, we haven't chosen a side… yet.
Support Paro, the real Druk Desi!
[Historical] Supporting Punakha might have long-term benefits….
Nonsense! We shall be free from any wars!
A Rival Druk Desi! - Trongsa's response
The Penlop of Trongsa has decided to join Paro's side!
A Rival Druk Desi! - Trongsa's response
The Penlop of Trongsa has decided to join Punakha's side!
A Rival Druk Desi! - Trongsa's response
The Penlop of Trongsa has refused to take any sides!
We have successfully crushed the opposing side and installed a Druk Desi that shall be way more friendlier to the Penlop of Paro…
A Friendship and Cooperation treaty with Bhutan

The recent civil war that plagued Bhutan has taken a toll on its population, and the legitimacy of its government, leaving it in a precarious position around its neighbors… Cue the British Empire, always seeking the wellbeing of those who are less fortunate, and technologically impaired, coming in with a very lucrative proposal for the small Himalayan nation of Bhutan: A friendship and mutual cooperation treaty consisting of turning Bhutan's Zhabdrung, a subordinate of the Druk Desi -the secular part of Bhutan's complex government- which is said to be the reincarnation of an ancient Lama, into an indirect vassal of $COUNTRY$ in exchange of bringing a civilizing mission of sorts to Bhutan. There is a high possibility that the Bhutanese won't agree to our terms, but there is always the last resort if they do not wish to cooperate: Take what is rightfully $COUNTRY_ADJ$ by force. The Duars form a legitimate part of the British Dominions in India, and if Bhutan does not concede us the permission needed for a civilizing mission, we shall readily have a pretext for annexing the Duars.
A Friendship and Cooperation treaty with the British Empire

In our weakened state, the British wish to sign a Treaty of Friendship and Cooperation which will leave all political matters in their hands and shall technically making our Zhabdrung a British subordinate. Several nobles and lamas are outraged at the proposal, but the benefits might outweigh its drawbacks: A civilizing mission which will bring Bhutan to modernity, or so they say. The Greater part of our nobility is skeptical of their intentions, citing their lust for the Duars we've been holding onto for several decades now, but whatever it is the case, we must make a very important decision right now… Shall we accept their proposition?
Indeed, the British shall protect us.
A Friendship and Cooperation treaty with Bhutan
Bhutan has acceded to sign the treaty, which shall promptly make them our subordinates.
A Friendship and Cooperation treaty with Bhutan
Bhutan has acceded to sign the treaty, which shall promptly make them our subordinates.
A Friendship and Cooperation treaty with the British Empire
One of the treaty's clauses cited the secession of the Assamese and Bengali Duars, which shall promptly be done.
The price of modernity, I'm sure.
A Friendship and Cooperation treaty with Bhutan
Bhutan has refused to sign the treaty… Leaving us with no choice but to forcibly annex the Duars.
No, the Duars are most definitively not worth it.
A 'Friendship' and 'Cooperation' treaty with the British Empire
The British Empire, as some of us had expected, has declared war on us. Citing an obscure clause which from a treaty signed decades ago which gave them suzerainty over the Assamese and Bengal Duars.
May their souls be forgiven. To arms!

Now that Bhutan has been properly dealt with, we can enforce a treaty which will transfer control of all the Duars to us, forcing them to forfeit any claims in the region in exchange of a hefty payment of fifty thousand Pounds or their equivalent in Rupees while also normalizing any relations between our nations.

Upon the conclusion of the Duar War, the British are enforcing a treaty which will transfer control of all the Duars to them, forcing us to forfeit any claims in the region in exchange of a hefty payment of fifty thousand Pounds or their equivalent in Rupees while also normalizing any relations between our nations.

While the British are stuck in a costly war for a severely underdeveloped backwater, we could force them to sign a treaty which shall be favorable to us. By occupying their administrative center in Calcutta, as well as our rightful claims in the region, we could technically force them to sign a treaty to revert all their territorial claims and finally leave us alone in our endeavors.

While the British are stuck in a costly war for a severely underdeveloped backwater, we could force them to sign a treaty which shall be favorable to us. By occupying their administrative center in Calcutta, as well as our rightful claims in the region, we could technically force them to sign a treaty to revert all their territorial claims and finally leave us alone in our endeavors.
No! The war shall continue. We must defend our homeland at all costs!

The Bhutanese think they can enforce their terms on us, and while it is true that they had just conquered Calcutta, we cannot allow them to have their way. They wish for the return of all their conquered territories, including Koch Behar and the leased territories of Darjeeling in exchange for peace. They ask for no more, and while several nobles from Calcutta has already accepted defeat, the rest of India is not very willing to do so… Yet. What shall we do?
We cannot allow them into Ft. Williams, this war ends now.
The British have accepted our terms and handed over all the stolen territories!
The British refuse to sign the treaty! The war shall continue…

A farsighted strategist, young Ugyen Wangchuck of only 21 years of age, has risen through the noble houses of $COUNTRY$ to become a respectable general. While initially doubtful, his father the Druk Desi Jigme Namgyal of Bhutan, has recognized Ugyen's untapped potential… What shall the future have in store for this young man?
Perhaps he is the reincarnation of King Gesar…
The Death of the Druk Desi

The death of Druk Desi Jigme Namgyal was unexpected and it left a serious power vacuum in the country which might even lead to a very possible civil war of such magnitudes never seen before in Bhutan.
The Death of the Druk Desi

The death of Druk Desi Jigme Namgyal was unexpected and it left a serious power vacuum in the country, we can seize this opportunity to install our own pro-$COUNTRY$ and finally unite the country properly! The other Penlops won't be likely to accept our candidate however, so the situation might devolve into civil war.
The Death of the Druk Desi
We have emerged victorious from the latest civil war, and while the country of Bhutan still remains somewhat internally disunited, we maintain enough power to keep it from crumbling apart.

Sikkim has always had a long history of relations with Tibet, and in the tumultuous times we are living in, some of our most trusted diplomats are suggesting the Chogyal to do a pilgrimage to Tibet for religious guidance… Much to the displeasure of the British, who have reminded our ruler about his duties to the British crown. What shall we do, my Lord?

Sikkim has always had a long history of relations with Tibet, and in the tumultuous times we are living in, some of our most trusted diplomats are suggesting the Chogyal to do a pilgrimage to Tibet for religious guidance… Much to the displeasure of the British, who have reminded our ruler about his duties to the British crown. What shall we do, my Lord?
Indeed the Chogyal needs to clear his mind, onwards to Tibet!
We mustn't anger the British, the Chogyal ought to stay.
Our Ambassadors inform us that they have just received the Chogyal of Sikkim, who is looking for spiritual guidance from the Lama.

It has been more than one year after the partying of the Chogyal, who is still in Tibet. The British Ambassador is growing weary of waiting for his Excellence's, as if the Great Chogyal of Sikkim were some lowly peasant who must answer to those foreigners. Indeed it has been a long time since he left, and perhaps it could be time to come back home.
Indeed, the Chogyal must come back.
The Chogyal is free to return whenever he wants
After much deliberation, the Chogyal has decided to come back home to Sikkim.

Trouble brews in Sikkim as the British Ambassador grows weary from waiting for the Chogyal's return. The ruler of Sikkim is still here in $COUNTRY$ looking for religious guidance from the Lama whilst the British have given us an ultimatum: Tell the Chogyal to return or there shall be consequences. What shall we do, Your Holiness? Our diplomats are split in opinion, some wish for the Chogyal to return home lest we get in trouble with the British and others wish to use our influence on the Chogyal to gain a hold on Sikkim. The Chogyal is very sympathetic to our people and believes our destinies to be tied.
Use our influence to put the Chogyal on our side…
Fearing British reprisals, the Chogyal has been told to go back home in a fairly rude manner…
And we thought the Tibetans were our friends…
As the Chogyal believes our destinies to be tied together, he has decided it would be best to become more entwined with the Tibetans, giving them control of our diplomacy. The British are enraged.

Much against the Lord Ambassador's suggestions, the Chogyal of Sikkim has decided to permanently stay in Tibet, handing them over every political institution of their country and letting them occupy most of the border passes between their nations. This is clearly an aggression against Her Majesty's wishes…
How dare they decide their own destiny?!

It has been well over two years since the Chogyal of Sikkim left his office for Tibet, and more than one year since the Tibetans took de facto power in Sikkim. The $COUNTRY$ ought to do something about this, as it cannot stand for such insults: We owned them, and we shall own them once more. Plus we cannot allow them to fall in the hands of Russia, our archenemy who wishes for supremacy in Asia!
Tell the Chogyal to come back, or else…
Let him be, we have no use for Sikkim
The British Empire is outraged by the Chogyal's decision to stay in Tibet and are threatening to invade if their wishes are not met.
Ignore them, their Queen is a ravenous she-wolf.

The British Empire is outraged by the Chogyal's decision to stay in Tibet and are threatening to invade if their wishes are not met. Sikkim is seeking a response from the Lama, lest the situation devolves into something more exreme.
The Chogyal stays as per his wishes.
Advice the Chogyal to go back home.
Sikkim's answer has been made clear and doubt influenced by Tibet: The Chogyal ought to stay in Tibet as those as his wishes. What shall we do Your Majesty? We cannot stand for this…
Then we shall bring them to our fold…

Sikkim's answer has been made clear and doubt influenced by Tibet: The Chogyal ought to stay in Tibet as those as his wishes. As the British Empire cannot stand for this, we shall bring them back to our fold using force.
The British have decided to bring back Sikkim into their fold using force, thus they wish to contest their influence in the battlefield.
The Chogyal of Sikkim has made the right choice and followed our Lord Ambassador's advice to go back home.
The Chogyal of Sikkim has made the right choice and followed the British Lord Ambassador's advice to go back home.

Now that Sikkim has been properly dealt with, we can enforce a treaty which will transfer control of all of Sikkim to us, forcing them to forfeit any claims in the region while also normalizing any relations between our nations.

Now that the British have been properly dealt with, we can enforce a treaty which will transfer control of all Sikkim to us, forcing them to forfeit any claims in Sikkim while also normalizing any relations between our nations.

Now that the British have been properly dealt with, we can enforce a treaty which will transfer control of all Sikkim to us, forcing them to forfeit any claims in Sikkim while also normalizing any relations between our nations.

The Tibetans think they can enforce their terms on us, and while it is true that they had just conquered Calcutta, we cannot allow them to have their way. They wish for control of all of Sikkim in exchange for peace. They ask for no more, and while several nobles from Calcutta have already accepted defeat, the rest of India is not very willing to do so… Yet. What shall we do?
We cannot allow them into Ft. Williams, this war ends now.
The British have accepted our terms and have recognized our sovereignty over Sikkim!
The British refuse to sign the treaty! The war shall continue…

Upon the conclusion of the Sikkim Expedition, the British are enforcing a treaty which will transfer political control of Sikkim to them, forcing us to forfeit any claims in the region in exchange of peace while also normalizing any relations between our nations.

Upon the conclusion of the Sikkim Expedition, the British are enforcing a treaty which will transfer political control of Sikkim to them, forcing us to forfeit any claims in the region in exchange of peace while also normalizing any relations between our nations.

Upon the Qing relinquishment of the Zhetysu, Russian Explorers and Merchants began settling around the upper Ili Basin, mostly in the city of Ningyuan, or Qulja as the Turki Taranchis call it. Recent unrest however, has put our Russian subjects in danger, allowing us to obtain an excuse for the annexation of this territory. If this decision is carried over, we can only imagine the Qing Emperor won't be happy about it, but it could surely open up many possibilities of future Russian endeavors in Dzungaria and the Altishahr.
Russians take over the Upper Ili Basin!

In a move of unprecedented aggression, the Russians have taken advantage of the current unrest in Xinjiang and forcibly annexed the city of Ningyuan, also known as Qulja by the local Taranchi, with the pretext of protecting Russian Subjects and their properties in the area!

Since the Peking Convention, the Russian Empire has recognized the Lake Balkhash as the natural frontiers between Russia and Northwest China. There are many within the government, however, who believe it would be in our best interest to access a land port upon the Dzungarian Basin for easier access to the thriving markets of the Altishahr. Considering the Chinese only barely control their northwestern provinces, it seems within our right to negotiate for their control… and with their state of turmoil now is the best time to approach them.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has accepted our proposal. Their border with Russia has been adjusted and the treaty signed.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has foolishly refused our claims and threatened to execute $COUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats. An outrage!

The Amban, our Imperial representative from Peking and effectively the governor of $COUNTRY$, has informed our government that $FROMCOUNTRY$ has concluded a treaty with Russia -- a treaty that includes portions of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ territory, with now must be handed over without comment. Should we refuse, we face war with $FROMCOUNTRY$ and Russia both.
We have no choice but to comply.
Never! They must take it from us!
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused to surrender its territory to Russia. They have ejected our Imperial governor and armed their soldiers against us!

A diplomat from Russia has arrived in $COUNTRY$ with an infuriating demand: they wish to readjust the borders on our northwestern frontier. They wish project their power in Central Asia, meaning all of the Yetisu would be turned over to them. Any $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$-claimed territory would be handed over by us and our vassals. This is surely a wicked threat, capitalizing on our current perceived weakness. Accepting it will also mean any of our vassals in the region will have to be integrated back into our country, to avoid this situation in the future.
We have no choice but to accept.

We have finally managed to quell down the rebellious northwestern provinces, and soon enough Russia finds itself in a dire situation for having occupied the Upper Ili Basin -without international recognition- by employing the pretext of protecting its citizens. We must send an envoy to the Crimean city of Livadia, demanding Russia to ensure the integrity of our realm.

The Qing Empire has finally managed to quell down the rebellions in its northwestern provinces, and soon enough we find ourselves in a dire situation for having occupied the Upper Ili Basin with the pretext of protecting our citizens. The Qing Emperor has sent an envoy to the Crimean city of Livadia, demanding $COUNTRY$ to hand over its former territories and ensuring the integrity of his realm… we must now decide the fate of this endeavor.
Propose to keep only Ili and an indemnity for our losses.
Simply hand over the occupied territories.

Our envoy is back, after days of deliberation, he has accepted -without the Emperor's consent- $FROMCOUNTRY$'s proposal to return a portion of Xinjiang to China while keeping the western Ili Valley, the right to open seven new consulates and duty-free trade in Xinjiang and Mongolia and an indemnity of sixty-thousand pounds to cover occupation costs and property losses.
No deal! This is an outrage! Chop the envoy's head off!
Our envoy is back, after days of deliberation, $FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided to simply hand back our territories!
The Qing Emperor has decided to refuse our proposal, citing that it is not in their best interest!
Curse them, this is going nowhere!
The Qing Emperor has decided to accept our proposal!

The failed Treaty of Livadia was a farce, and our envoy should have known better than that. Even still, we cannot keep ignoring the fact that Russia is still occupying territories which rightly belong to our Emperor. Another round of negotiations must commence, but this time we shall do so closer to home, in the Russian-occupied territories of the upper Ili. Make our Ambassadors meet with their Russian counterparts and let us discuss the safe return of the Emperor's rightful territories.

After the lessons learned from the failed Treaty of Livadia, the Qing Emperor has decided to commence another round of negotiations for the Upper Ili Basin. Their demands are simple: The return of the Russian-occupied territories. But we know better than that, and so do our Ambassadors, who are agreeing that Russia should return all the occupied provinces, but not without opening a consulate network in Xinjiang, Kumul and Outer Mongolia, demanding an indemnification of seventy-thousand Pounds to serve as a payment for the occupation costs, compensation for the claims of Russian subjects who lost their property during the rebellion, and for material assistance to the families of Russian subjects killed during the rebellion. And finally, to hold the residents of the area, regardless of their ethnicity and religion, harmless for their actions during the rebellion. The residents of the area would be allowed to stay or to move to the Russian Empire, and they would be asked about their choice before the withdrawal of the Russian troops.
Indeed, those demands seem reasonable enough.
Those territories are now part of the Russian Empire…

After days of deliberation, the Russians have agreed to return all the occupied provinces, but not without opening a consulate network in Xinjiang, Kumul and Outer Mongolia, demanding an indemnification of seventy-thousand Pounds to serve as a payment for the occupation costs, compensation for the claims of Russian subjects who lost their property during the rebellion, and for material assistance to the families of Russian subjects killed during the rebellion. And finally, to hold the residents of the area, regardless of their ethnicity and religion, harmless for their actions during the rebellion. The residents of the area would be allowed to stay or to move to the Russian Empire, and they would be asked about their choice before the withdrawal of the Russian troops.
No deal! This is an outrage!
After days of deliberation, $FROMCOUNTRY$ has decided to keep our rightful territories! They are now considered to be part of the Russian Empire!
The Qing Emperor has decided to accept our proposal!
The Qing Emperor has decided to refuse our proposal, citing that it is not in their best interest!
The Great Game Comes to Yedishahr
We must press our domination of Central Asia. This means that Yedishahr must join our nation, or stand forever more subject to Foreign aggression in the region.
The conquest of Tarim and Dzungaria
We must press our domination of Central Asia by completing the conquest of Tarim and Dzungaria, as they remained outside our control upon having conquered the Yedishahr Emirate.
The Great Game Comes to Tibet
We must press our domination of Central Asia. This means that Tibet must join our nation, or stand forever more subject to British aggression in the region.
The Great Game Comes to Burma
We must press our domination of Asia. This means that Burma must join our nation, or stand forever more subject to British aggression in the region.
The Great Game Comes to Wakhan
We must press our domination of Cental Asia. This means that Wakhan must join our nation, or stand forever more subject to British aggression in the region.
The Great Game Comes to Darwaz
We must press our domination of Cental Asia. This means that Darwaz must join our nation, or stand forever more subject to British aggression in the region.

§WThe first main goal of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ measures must be strict segregation of the §YIranians - that is, the Persians, Tajiks, Pashtuns, Baluchi, §W- from the rest of the population. In the execution of this, first of all, is the seizing of the Iranian-Turanian population by the introduction of a registration order and similar appropriate measures. All rights of freedom for the Iranians are to be withdrawn. They are to be placed in internment camps and at the same time are to be separated according to sexes. These internment camps can be placed under the supervision of their own Iranian self-government with Iranian officials. The guarding of the boundaries between the internment camps and the outer world, is, however, the duty of the Police."\n\n§YAdds 3 points to the "slowdown" scale. Starting at 4 points, every 2 points will decrease speed by 20%.

In the execution of this, first of all, is the seizing of the Greek population by the introduction of a registration order and similar appropriate measures.
